subject: Offline Quiz Arrangement for Absentees
snippet: Dear Students, Those who missed the quiz are required to fill out the attached Excel sheet with your ID number and name. Your quiz will be arranged offline on 04/04/25 from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM at
content:
Dear Students,

Those who missed the quiz are required to fill out the attached *Excel
sheet* with your *ID number and name*. Your quiz will be arranged *offline*
on 04/04/25* from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM* at *CSPIT, Room No. 310*.

Please note that *absence from this offline quiz will result in a score of
zero*. Kindly ensure your presence.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1gB0Pmo-llobTX_Kh2zlQF63bvQSrFazvLpOQ93UeSZ0/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

*NOTE* :
DEADLINE FOR REGISTRATION ARE EXTENDED TILL 7th April 2025


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeqw-dwcGPZxyFV196urPrrAdpQljpJn72pVQy4-0QQjfVExQ/viewform?usp=header


For further Queries you can Contact:

nakshatraaerospaceclub@gmail.com

subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 7:08 AM Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 7:08‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition
2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05‚ÄØam
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabulary‚Äîskills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid format‚Äîonline preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18cFYJTXo0Yq6zmen456z8H28ukWH2QGc/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=176b1da9e198e0df1317262dc16b4adeb16352b9&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>



*With Warm Regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,

subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity Challenge.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:30 PM Subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:30‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:20‚ÄØPM
Subject: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE2/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear Faculty,

We are pleased to announce the launch of the "NCIIPC-AICTE PENTATHON 2025",
a premier National-level Hackathon on Capture the Flag (CTF) Challenge and
Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Testing (VAPT). This initiative is
jointly organized by NCIIPC, AICTE, and MIC to identify and nurture the top
cybersecurity talent.

In this regard, we are pleased to inform you the launch of the Pentathon
2025 by the Chairman, AICTE and DG, NCIIPC. We request you to please join
the program online through the below link:

https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m041db1742c446d1739d836000977d27d
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=90873d9a65d4365dd2be6bdc622058d7f74c12f0&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

Date: 26th March 2025
Time: 3:00 PM

*Stages of PENTATHON 2025*:

   1. * Stage 1*: Online Qualification Round. (*5-6thApril 2025)*

 - A jeopardy-style CTF challenge covering Web Attacks, Network
Exploitation, API Vulnerabilities, OT    SCADA, and more.

   2. * Stage 2*: Physical Grand Finale (*1-3rdMay 2025) (Tentative)*

 - A high-stakes live cybersecurity exercise focused on protecting Critical
Information Infrastructure (CII) from advanced cyber threats.

   3. *Stage 3*: Bootcamp and Training for shortlisted teams. *(June2025)
   (Tentative)*

We request you to please join live for the inaugural ceremony for the
launch of NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025. We look forward to your
participation in this prestigious event. For any queries, feel free to
reach out at 011-29581240, 1241 or email: pentathon@aicte-india.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7d6f018fde1112603239e954101e90ee3c15c79b&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xRJeUZPdxDolW18KhQATIdzytI31EzTZ/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=cca47c88bdd3e7aea486d2655d5769f4c97dfaab&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>


*Best regards, *

*PENTATHON 2025**(Organizing Team)*
Share it on Social Media [image: social icon]
<https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjan-sampark.nic.in%2Fcampaigns%2F2025%2F26-Mar%2FAICTE2%2Findex.html>

content:

New Event Alert üöÄ

Hello,

A new Event has been created : Hands-on Workshop on "Web Development : From
Concepts to Code".

   - Date: Saturday, April 5, 2025
   - Time: 09:30 AM
   - Location: 229 SH, First Floor, A5 Building, CHARUSAT

Are you ready to dive into the world of web development? Join us for an

Don't miss out! Click the button below to learn more:

Liberal arts courses encourage me to express my individuality.

I now feel confident adjusting camera settings to achieve the desired

Learning about light meters has improved my ability to measure and

The final project has helped me apply what I learned to create a

The guidance provided throughout the project helped me refine my creative

This course has expanded my understanding of different photographic

Experimenting with digital media has allowed me to explore new creative

Learning about persona and non-objective photography has broadened my

subject: Liberal Arts Photography Workshop: University Exam Scheduled Tomorrow on 28th March, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Please be informed that the University Exam for HSUS102: Photography is scheduled tomorrow (ie March 28, 2025), on the 4th day of the Photography Workshop of Liberal Art 2025. It is
content:
*Dear Students,*

Please be informed that the *University Exam for HSUS102: Photography* is
scheduled *tomorrow (i.e. March 28, 2025)*, on the *4th day of the
Photography Workshop of Liberal Art 2025*.

*It is mandatory for all students to be present for the exam, as no re-exam
will be conducted. Absence will result in a backlog.*

*Exam Pattern:*

¬∑        *Photo Assessment: 40 Marks*

¬∑        *Viva: 40 Marks*

¬∑        *Quiz: 20 Marks*

*Kindly note the following schedule for DAY-4 of Liberal Arts-2025.*

*The Photography Workshop Day-4 (i.e. March 28, 2025)* schedule is attached
herewith.


*Kindly report to your venue: SEMINAR HALL-2 (301), EC-EE Building, CSPIT
by 9.10 pm tomorrow.*


*The reference/reading material is attached for your preparation of VIVA
(40 Marks) & QUIZ (20 Marks). *

*[The questions for VIVA & QUIZ will also be from the learning lessons of 4
days' sessions by various experts]*

*Also refer to the content of online course assigned on Day-1*

*The detailed schedule of DAY-4 is attached herewith for your reference.*

For any queries, please reach out at the earliest.


*All the best!*


With regards,
*Venue In charge: Dr. Hiren Patel - 9879092416 & Ms. Priyanka Patel -
7048746279*


*Dr. Hiren Patel *
*Assistant Professor*

*Faculty of Humanities (FoH),*

*Department of Humanities & Social Sciences,*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management,*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology [CHARUSAT]*
*Accredited with "A+ Grade" by NAAC*
*At-Changa, Ta-Petlad, Dist-Anand, Gujarat.*
*EMAIL ID: hirenpatel.cs@charusat.ac.in <hirenpatel.cs@charusat.ac.in>*
*CONTACT NO. : 9879092416*

snippet: Dear students, You can collect your checked assignment notebooks for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II) from Staff Room 309 in the EC/EE building. Kindly note that those students who have not yet
content:
Dear students,

You can collect your checked assignment notebooks for MSUD102 (Engineering
Mathematics II) from Staff Room 309 in the EC/EE building.

*Kindly note that those students who have not yet submitted their
assignments must have to submit it by 31st March,2025. *

Thank you.
-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

* M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*


* Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for all B.Tech students!
The Nakshatra Aerospace Club is officially recruiting new members, and we
want YOU to be a part of this Stellar journey into the world of Aerospace
innovation!


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdpMxTKdA4gNtlLeGDoM0W5D6Ch-tKuZQnDJlMonw97xbJpGQ/viewform

Greetings fom Faculty‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings LIBERAL ARTS 2025 - PHOTOGRAPHY DEPSTAR STUDENTS @Seminar Hall-2 EC-EE Building New announcement Dear Students, Greetings fom Faculty of Humanities - CHARUSAT! The Liberal Arts
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs011@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs011@charusat.edu.in>

Building  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyOTg4NTM5MTk1?email%3D24dcs011@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs011@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

Dear Students,

Greetings fom Faculty of Humanities - CHARUSAT!

The Liberal Arts courses will be conducted in a Workshop Mode from March 25  
to March 28, 2025, between 9:10 AM and 4:30 PM each day. This is a 2-credit  
course, and participation in all sessions is mandatory for successful  
completion.

Kindly join the Google Classroom Group through this link:
https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyOTg4NTM5MTk1?cjc=w6xyvtht

Important Instructions
1. Reporting and Attendance

    - You must report to venue (Kindly check the SCHEDULE & SOP letter  
attached with this mail) at 09:10 AM daily during these 4 days.
    - 100% attendance is mandatory for successful completion of this  
workshop.
    - You must report on time every day, at least 10 minutes before the  
scheduled time.

2. Course Requirements and Evaluation

    - The course follows a Continuous Mode of Assessment.
    - Every session will be followed by tasks or assignments, which must be  
completed within the given deadline.
    - You are required to complete all practical exercises and assignments  
as part of your Internal and External Evaluation.

3. Conduct and Discipline

    - As external resource persons will be conducting sessions, all students  
are expected to maintain discipline, decorum, and professionalism in line  
with university standards.
    - You are required to carry your University Identity Card throughout the  
workshop.
    - All students must remain at the venue until the final instructions are  
provided by the Course Coordinator at the end of the workshop.

4. Submission and Completion

    - During the workshop, students will be required to submit specific  
assignments as part of the evaluation process.
    - Internal and External Evaluations will take place during the workshop,  
and successful completion of all evaluation components is required to pass  
the course.

For detailed information regarding the syllabus, evaluation scheme, and  
other course-related aspects, please refer to the documents provided in  
your kit.
We look forward to an exciting and enriching learning experience with you.

Please find the attachments of COPIES OF SCHEDULE: DAY-1, SYLLABUS OF  
PHOTOGRAPHY, KIT LETTER, SOP LETTER (Standard Operating Procedure) for  
LIBERAL ARTS - 2025 (25-28 MARCH 2025)

VENUE: Seminar Hall-2, EC-EE building, 2nd Floor, CSPIT-CHARUSAT.

With Best Regards,
Venue Coordinator: Dr. Hiren Patel - 9879092416 & Ms. Priyanka Patel -  
7048746279

subject: Important: Online Quiz Scheduled on March 29th ‚Äì Instructions Inside
snippet: Dear Students, The first online quiz is scheduled for March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM. Please keep the following points in mind: The quiz consists of 5 MCQs and must be completed within 10 minutes.
content:
*Dear Students,*

The first online quiz is scheduled for *March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM*.
Please keep the following points in mind:

   1.

   The quiz consists of *5 MCQs* and must be completed within *10 minutes*.
   2.

   Incorrect *ID inputs* will not be considered and will result in *zero
   marks*.
   3.

   Ensure you are in a *stable network environment*. Any *network or
   technical issues will not be considered*.
   4.

   The *Google Form link* will be sent to you via email on the day of the
   quiz.
   5.

   Login is allowed *only* using your *Charusat email ID*.
   6.

   For any queries, please write an email.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *
*‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ß‡•à‡§µ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ü‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ï‡§Æ*

--

subject: Summer Internship Opportunities ‚Äì 2025 at CROWN Software
snippet: Dear Students, Please apply for the Summer Internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if interested. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <hr@glexas.com> Date: Mon, 24 Mar, 2025, 9:48 pm
content:
Dear Students,

Please apply for the Summer Internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if
interested.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <hr@glexas.com>
Date: Mon, 24 Mar, 2025, 9:48 pm
Subject: Summer Internship Opportunities ‚Äì 2025
To: Ashwinmakwana Ce <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Ma'am,

Greetings!

As part of our ongoing collaboration over the years, we are pleased to
extend *summer internship opportunities* for students once again for 2025.
We truly appreciate the support of your institution in connecting students
with industry exposure, and we look forward to continuing this association.

This year, we are offering a *7-8 week internship program* (from *10-05-2025
to 04-07-2025*) in the following domains:

   1.

   *Flutter Developer* ‚Äì Mobile app development using Flutter, Dart,
   Firebase - 4
   2.

   *Website Developer* ‚Äì Frontend & Backend development (Html, css,
   Javascript) - 4
   3.

   *REST API Developer* ‚Äì API development & integration using PHP, SQL - 3
   4.

   *UI/UX Designer* ‚Äì Wireframing, prototyping, designing, video creation
   using Figma -3
   5.

   *QA & Testing* ‚Äì Manual and automated testing, bug tracking, and
   reporting - 3

Selection Process:

   -

   Shortlisting based on resume screening
   -

   Followed by a technical interview (online/offline)

Mode of Internship:

   -

   Hybrid (online/offline, depending on project requirements)

We would be grateful if you could kindly forward this opportunity to your
students who might be interested. They can apply using the following *Google
Form*:
https://forms.gle/pw7qPqNViLydodnU8

Please let us know if you require any additional information or if there
are any formalities to proceed with this collaboration. Looking forward to
your kind response.

Best regards,
CROWN Software


-- 
regards
Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science And Technology

--

subject: Regarding Liberal Arts - Photography (HSUS102)
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! The Liberal Arts courses will be conducted in a Workshop Mode from March 25 to March 28, 2025, between 9:10 AM and 4:30 PM each day. This is a 2-credit course, and
content:
*Dear Students,*
*Greetings!*

The *Liberal Arts courses will be conducted in a Workshop Mode from March
25 to March 28, 2025*, between *9:10 AM and 4:30 PM* each day. This is
a *2-credit
course*, and participation in all sessions is mandatory for successful
completion.

*Kindly join the Google Classroom Group through this link: *
https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyOTg4NTM5MTk1?cjc=w6xyvtht

*Important Instructions*

*1. Reporting and Attendance*

   - You must report to *venue (Kindly check the SCHEDULE & SOP letter
   attached with this mail) at 09:10 AM daily during these 4 days.*
   - *100% attendance is mandatory* for successful completion of this
   workshop.
   - You must report *on time* every day, at least *10 minutes before the
   scheduled time*.

*2. Course Requirements and Evaluation*

   - The course follows a *Continuous Mode of Assessment*.
   - Every session will be followed by *tasks or assignments*, which must
   be completed *within the given deadline*.
   - You are required to complete all *practical exercises and assignments* as
   part of your *Internal and External Evaluation*.

*3. Conduct and Discipline*

   - As *external resource persons* will be conducting sessions, all
   students are expected to *maintain discipline, decorum, and
   professionalism* in line with university standards.
   - You are required to carry your *University Identity Card* throughout
   the workshop.
   - All students must remain at the venue until the *final instructions* are
   provided by the Course Coordinator at the end of the workshop.

*4. Submission and Completion*

   - During the workshop, students will be required to *submit specific
   assignments* as part of the evaluation process.
   - Internal and External Evaluations will take place during the workshop,
   and successful completion of *all evaluation components* is required to
   pass the course.

For detailed information regarding the syllabus, evaluation scheme, and
other course-related aspects, please refer to the documents provided in
your kit.

We look forward to an exciting and enriching learning experience with you.


*Please find the attachments of COPIES OF 4 DAYS SCHEDULE, SYLLABUS OF
COURSES, KIT LETTERS, SOP LETTER (Standard Operating Procedure) for LIBERAL
ARTS - 2025 (25-28 MARCH* *2025)*

*VENUE: Seminar hall 2, EC building*


*With Best Regards,*

*Venue Coordinator: Dr. Hiren Patel - 9879092416 & Ms. Priyanka Patel -
7048746279*

--

subject: Re: Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)
snippet: Tomorrow is last day. Dear Sir, Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of Undergraduate
content:
Tomorrow is last day.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Dear Sir,*
>
>
>
> *Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai
> Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of
> Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)*
>
>
>
> *You are requested to send the filled form with documents received from
> the eligible students latest by 28th march 2025.*
>
> *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*
>
>
>
>  NOTICE
>
>
> *Date: 05/03/2025*
>
>
> Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel
> Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate
> Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)
>
>
>
> This is for information to all the concerned students that Bhupendrabhai
> Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means
> Scholarship will be awarded to Undergraduate program Student of *DEPSTAR *for
> academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:
> Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:
>
>
>
> v  The Student of F Y B Tech whose 12th Standard result is more than 70
> Percentage & family income is not more than Rs. 7 lacs will be eligible to
> apply
>
> v  To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has
> to secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every Year without backlog.
>
> v  In case, student will not score minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive Year,
> then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student.
>
> v  Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
> admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
> apply.
>
> v  The Scholarship will be awarded to maximum one eligible student of
> DEPSTAR
>
>
>
> *The forms for the scholarship are available and is to be submitted as per
> following details:*
>
>
>
> *Name of Institute*
>
> *Forms to be collected from*
>
> DEPSTAR
>
> Mr. Dharmendra Patel
>
>
>

>
>
>
>

> *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*
> *CHARUSAT CAMPUS, CHANGA*

subject: Re: Collection of Photography Kit - Liberal Arts
snippet: Dear Students, It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from tomorrow. Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your internal and external exam
content:
Dear Students,

It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from
tomorrow.

Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your
internal and external exam evaluation will be done within these four days
only.

We have already provided the needed documents in your photography Kit, and
they are attached to this email. Kindly study them thoroughly.

Carry your ID card without fail.

In case you have not collected your Kit of Photography yet, do it now and
collect it from Room 220, First Floor, IIIM Building before 3:00 PM today

*Refer to Day-1 Time-table and reach your Day-1 Venue by 9:10 am tomorrow
without fail.*


With regards,

Kaushik Trivedi

On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 5:31‚ÄØPM Kaushik Trivedi <
kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> *Kindly collect your Photography Kit tomorrow (i.e. March 19, 2025), from
> Room No. 220, First Floor, IIIM Building (Beside Sports Ground) as per the
> following  time slot without fail:*
>
>    - *11:10 am - 01:10 pm*
>
> Mahendra Sir will guide you for the same.
>
> With regards,
>
> Kaushik Trivedi
>
> On Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:17‚ÄØAM Kaushik Trivedi <
> kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Students,
>>
>>
>> Good Morning!
>>
>>

>> *E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography
>> (HSUS102)* course.
>>
>>
>>
>> We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
>> course on *Liberal Arts*.
>>
>> Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
>> be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
>> 25-28, 2025.*
>>
>>
>> *Please make a note of following:*
>>
>> 1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop
>> Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).
>>
>> 2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
>> said dates without fail.
>>
>> 3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
>> tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
>> backlog.*
>>
>> 4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
>> Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
>> 9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
>> members will guide you for the same.
>>
>> 5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
>> and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
>> students will be required to manage it.
>>
>> 6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.
>>
>> 7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
>> need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).
>>
>> 8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned
>> to them.
>>
>> 9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
>> required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
>> university and professional programs.
>>
>> 10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
>>
>> 11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be
>> taken.
>>
>> 12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
>> carried out during these four days only.*
>>
>> 13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
>> other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
>> via email.
>>
>> 14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
>> Persons / Faculty Coordinators.
>>
>>
>> *In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or
>> contact me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*

>>
>>

subject: Re: Collection of Photography Kit - Liberal Arts
snippet: Dear Students, It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from tomorrow. Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your internal and external exam
content:
Dear Students,

It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from
tomorrow.

Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your
internal and external exam evaluation will be done within these four days
only.

We have already provided the needed documents in your photography Kit, and
they are attached to this email. Kindly study them thoroughly.

Carry your ID card without fail.

In case you have not collected your Kit of Photography yet, do it now and
collect it from Room 220, First Floor, IIIM Building before 3:00 PM today

*Refer to Day-1 Time-table and reach your Day-1 Venue by 9:10 am tomorrow
without fail.*


With regards,

Kaushik Trivedi

On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 5:31‚ÄØPM Kaushik Trivedi <
kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> *Kindly collect your Photography Kit tomorrow (i.e. March 19, 2025), from
> Room No. 220, First Floor, IIIM Building (Beside Sports Ground) as per the
> following  time slot without fail:*
>
>    - *11:10 am - 01:10 pm*
>
> Mahendra Sir will guide you for the same.
>
> With regards,
>
> Kaushik Trivedi
>
> On Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:17‚ÄØAM Kaushik Trivedi <
> kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Students,
>>
>>
>> Good Morning!
>>
>>
>> This email is with reference to your liberal arts course registration on
>> *E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography
>> (HSUS102)* course.
>>
>>
>>
>> We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
>> course on *Liberal Arts*.
>>
>> Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
>> be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
>> 25-28, 2025.*
>>
>>
>> *Please make a note of following:*
>>
>> 1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop
>> Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).
>>
>> 2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
>> said dates without fail.
>>
>> 3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
>> tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
>> backlog.*
>>
>> 4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
>> Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
>> 9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
>> members will guide you for the same.
>>
>> 5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
>> and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
>> students will be required to manage it.
>>
>> 6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.
>>
>> 7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
>> need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).
>>
>> 8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned
>> to them.
>>
>> 9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
>> required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
>> university and professional programs.
>>
>> 10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
>>
>> 11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be
>> taken.
>>
>> 12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
>> carried out during these four days only.*
>>
>> 13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
>> other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
>> via email.
>>
>> 14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
>> Persons / Faculty Coordinators.
>>
>>
>> *In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or
>> contact me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*
>>
>>
>>
>> With regards,
>>
>>
>> Dr. Kaushik Trivedi
>>
>> Course Coordinator (Photography)
>>
>> Liberal Arts - 2025
>>

subject: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year Students, The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the details below: Date: 29/03/2025 Day:
content:
Dear First-Year Students,

The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
details below:

*Date:* 29/03/2025

*Day:* Saturday

*Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM

*Mode:* Online (Google Form)

*Total Marks:* 25 MCQs

*Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment

The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.

The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

Quiz 1

Quiz 2

Lab Manual

Journal

20%

20%

20%

40%

Ensure your availability and preparedness for the quiz. For any queries,
feel free to reach out to your lab-in-charge for further assistance.

Best regards,
Sanni


-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences

subject: "Internship_Career - Students of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY"
snippet: Dear Student bearing enrollment ID 24dcs011, From CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY. Congratulations! You've been selected for a unique 2-month Training & Internship program to give you valuable industry
content:
*Dear Student bearing enrollment ID 24dcs011, From CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY.*

*Congratulations! You've been selected* for a unique *2-month Training &
Internship program* to give you valuable industry experience. *LaunchEd
Global* is offering this opportunity, with *certifications* *verified by
WIPRO Dice ID* and aligned with *AICTE* standards.

*Fill out the Google Form to Apply to this program:*
                    *https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9*
<https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9>

*Here‚Äôs what you can expect:*

*1. Comprehensive Training:*

   - *Live Expert Sessions:* Evening classes (6:30 PM - 8:00 PM) via Zoom,
   guided by industry professionals.
   - *Skill Development:* Learn from foundational to advanced concepts,
   perfect for all levels.
   - *Practical AI:* Build applications, explore Generative AI, and master
   prompt engineering with minimal coding.
   - *Flexible Learning:* Access recorded sessions on our LMS for 6 months
   after the program starts.

*2. Hands-On Internship Experience:*

   - *Individual Projects:* Complete 10+ focused projects, applying what
   you learn.
   - *Team Collaboration:* Work on a major capstone project in a group of
   3-4, with clear roles and responsibilities.
   - *Career Preparation:* Receive expert guidance on resume building and
   practice your interview skills with mock interviews.
   - *Industry Insights:* Learn from leaders at prominent global companies
   through masterclasses.

*Valuable Certifications:*

   - *Course Certificate:* Earn a certificate from IIT-KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate:* Receive a certificate from our partner
   companies.
   - *Verified Credibility:* Both certificates are verified by WIPRO Dice
   ID.
   - Ãâ*Career Support:* Join our community for placement assistance and
   connections with leading companies.

*Om Jena*
Senior Internship Counsellor, LaunchEd Global

subject: Fwd: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01 PM Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs To: <22aiml
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01‚ÄØPM
Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
To: <22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CSE <
hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>,
DEPSTAR_CE <depstar_ce@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar_CSE <
depstar_cse@charusat.ac.in>, DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>, HOD
AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

I hope this email finds you well.

Math for AI club under the Department of Artificial Intelligence & Machine
Learning, CSPIT, CHARUSAT is organizing an *Expert Talk* on the *"Math
Magic Behind GANs"* on March 21, 2025.

Discover the fascinating mathematical concepts that power *Generative
Adversarial Networks (GANs)*, one of the most revolutionary AI techniques
used in image synthesis, deep learning, and beyond.

This event is open to all students of the institute who are eager to
explore the intersection of *Mathematics and AI*. No prior GAN experience
is needed‚Äîjust bring your curiosity!

Join us for an interactive session that will deepen your understanding and
spark new insights.


*Session Details:*

   - *Date:* March 21, 2025
   - *Time:* 10:10 AM to 11:15 AM
   - *Venue:* Will be updated at the earliest.
   - *Last Date of Registration:*  21/03/2025 (09:00 PM)


*Registration Link:* https://tinyurl.com/8usp657c (Seats are limited)


Feel free to contact us for any queries on

*Pooja Mehta (22AIML020) - 6351857705 (Student Coordinator)*

*Kesha Desai (22AIML008) - 7573017335 **(Student Coordinator)*

*Spoorthy V. - 8310726037 **(Faculty Coordinator)*


We look forward to seeing you there!


*Please refer to the attached brochure for details. *

-- 
Thanks and regards,

*Dr. Spoorthy. V*,
Assistant Professor,
Department of AI-ML,
CSPIT, CHARUSAT Campus,
Highway, Off, Nadiad - Petlad Rd,
Changa, Gujarat 388421

--

>> *E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography
>> (HSUS102)* course.
>>
>>
>>
>> We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
>> course on *Liberal Arts*.
>>
>> Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
>> be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
>> 25-28, 2025.*
>>
>>
>> *Please make a note of following:*
>>
>> 1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop
>> Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).
>>
>> 2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
>> said dates without fail.
>>
>> 3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
>> tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
>> backlog.*
>>
>> 4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
>> Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
>> 9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
>> members will guide you for the same.
>>
>> 5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
>> and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
>> students will be required to manage it.
>>
>> 6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.
>>
>> 7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
>> need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).
>>
>> 8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned
>> to them.
>>
>> 9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
>> required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
>> university and professional programs.
>>
>> 10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
>>
>> 11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be
>> taken.
>>
>> 12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
>> carried out during these four days only.*
>>
>> 13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
>> other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
>> via email.
>>
>> 14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
>> Persons / Faculty Coordinators.
>>
>>
>> *In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or
>> contact me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*
>>
>>
>>
>> With regards,
>>
>>
>> Dr. Kaushik Trivedi
>>
>> Course Coordinator (Photography)
>>
>> Liberal Arts - 2025
>>
>

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation for Participation in Event GUSTAKHI 2025 ‚Äì Unleash Your Voice¬†
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 8:45 PM Subject: Invitation for Participation in Event GUSTAKHI 2025 ‚Äì Unleash Your
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 8:45‚ÄØPM
Subject: Invitation for Participation in Event GUSTAKHI 2025 ‚Äì Unleash Your
Voice
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are thrilled to invite all the students of CHARUSAT to participate in
the upcoming event *GUSTAKHI: Where Words and Actions Dare to Defy*, a
vibrant platform for fearless storytellers, bold visionaries, and defiant
poets to express their creativity and challenge norms jointly organised by
Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM), Faculty of Humanities
(FoH) and Women‚Äôs Development Cell (WDC-IIIM).

*üìÖ Date:* March 21, 2025

*üïí Time:* 10:00 AM onward

*üìç Venue:* IIIM, CHARUSAT Campus

Join us for four exciting events that celebrate artistic expression,
critical thinking, and bold ideas:
*1Ô∏è‚É£ Expert Talk:* *When We Cross the Laxman Rekha: Girls, Women, and
Boundaries to Freedom*

üéôÔ∏è Speaker: *Dr. Sonali Pattnaik* ‚Äì Award-winning Poet, Author, and Visual
Artist

üîó Register Here : https://forms.gle/CnDiYSumWmCV14FN6
*2Ô∏è‚É£ Panel Discussion:* *The Power of Dissent in Society*

üó£Ô∏è Engage in dynamic conversations exploring:

   - The role of rebellious narratives in shaping society
   - Challenges faced by women who speak against norms
   - Crab mentality ‚Äì Are women their own enemies?
   üîó Register Here : https://forms.gle/cxn9e3Tdp73RKwSQ8

*3Ô∏è‚É£ INK and Outrage:* *Your Writing Reflects Who You Are*

‚úçÔ∏è Showcase your creativity in *Poetry*, *Story Writing*, *Comic Creation*,
and more.
Theme: *Freedom*, *Identity*, *Womanhood*, *Self-Love*, and *All Gender
Neutral*
üîó Register Here: https://forms.gle/Z3UQ6JENtppGQRFh8
*4Ô∏è‚É£ Open Mic:* *Bebaak Batein*

üé§ Step into the spotlight with *Unfiltered Stories*, *Poetry*, and *Artistic
Performances* on bold themes.
üîó Register Here: https://forms.gle/Tz7JfZn75sZTqGxZ6

*üìù Registration Deadline:* March 20, 2025

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to showcase your talent and voice your thoughts
on bold and impactful themes. We encourage all CHARUSAT students to
participate and make GUSTAKHI 2025 a memorable event!

We look forward to an exciting and inspiring event!

For further details, feel free to contact :

*Event Coordinators:* Ms. Margi Mehta (8866486076)| Ms. Pranjal Bhatt
(9429296329)

*Event Convenors:* Dr. Binit Patel | Dr. Bhaskar Pandya
Thanking you in anticipation of your positive response,

With regards,


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

subject: Fwd: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making Competition Details
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07 PM Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07‚ÄØPM
Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
Competition Details
To: <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <pinalhansora.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <22cs051@charusat.edu.in>


Respected Sir,

I hope this email finds you well.

We, the *CSE NSS Unit*, are organizing a *Traffic Awareness Program* on *20th
March 2025* to spread awareness about road safety and responsible driving
among students. As part of this initiative, we are hosting a *Poster Making
Competition* on *18th March 2025*.

üìå *Competition Details:*

   - Open to all students of *Charusat University*
   - Teams of *2 or 3 members* can participate
   - Only *20 teams* will be selected on a *first-come, first-serve* basis
   - The best posters will be showcased at the *Traffic Awareness Program*
   - *Participants must bring their own laptops for designing the poster  *

We request you to kindly forward this information to all departments so
that interested students can participate. They can register by filling out
the form linked below:

üìç *Registration Link: *https://forms.gle/nFMfduwfUAyHPfzX6

Attached is the *poster for the event* for further reference.
[image: image.png]

For any queries, students can contact:
üìû  *9328068864 **, *99790 99218

We appreciate your support in spreading the word about this initiative.
Looking forward to your kind cooperation.

Best Regards,
Dhruvi mahale



-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

subject: Important: DEPSTAR - A Course on Liberal Arts | Photography (HSUS102) Workshop | March 25-28, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Good Morning! This email is with reference to your liberal arts course registration on E-Governance. You have enrolled yourself for the Photography (HSUS102) course. We are excited to
content:
Dear Students,


Good Morning!


This email is with reference to your liberal arts course registration on
*E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography (HSUS102)*
 course.



We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
course on *Liberal Arts*.

Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
25-28, 2025.*


*Please make a note of following:*

1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop Mode
from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).

2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
said dates without fail.

3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
backlog.*

4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
members will guide you for the same.

5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
students will be required to manage it.

6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.

7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).

8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned to
them.

9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
university and professional programs.

10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.

11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be taken.

12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
carried out during these four days only.*

13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
via email.

14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
Persons / Faculty Coordinators.


*In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or contact
me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*



With regards,


Dr. Kaushik Trivedi

Course Coordinator (Photography)

Liberal Arts - 2025

--

snippet: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT, Changa ---------- Forwarded message
content:
Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sanket Suthar <sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, 12 Mar 2025, 11:16 am
Subject: AWS Academy Registration for "Cloud Practitioner Foundational"-
March 2025
To: <22it@charusat.edu.in>, <22ce@charusat.edu.in>, <22cse@charusat.edu.in>,
<22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <22dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <22dit@charusat.edu.in>,
<22dce@charusat.edu.in>, <23it@charusat.edu.in>, <23ce@charusat.edu.in>, <
23cse@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23dcse@charusat.edu.in>,
<23dit@charusat.edu.in>, <23dce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <
24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24cse@charusat.edu.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <
24dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <24dit@charusat.edu.in>, <24dce@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE <hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Khushi Patel <
khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Radhika Patel <
radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Jaimin Undavia <
jaiminundavia.mca@charusat.ac.in>, Dharmendrasinh Rathod <
dharmendrarathod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Dharmendra Chauhan <
dharmendrachauhan.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Ronak Patel <
ronakpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Krishna Patel <krishnapatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>,
Chintal Raval <chintalraval.dit@charusat.ac.in>, Dheeraj Shringi <
dheerajshringi.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Gaurav Kumar <
gauravkumar.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
<head.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>, Dr
Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Parth Goel <
parthgoel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Chirag Patel <chiragpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>



*Dear All, *


We're excited to announce the upcoming batch of the AWS Academy's *"Cloud
Practitioner Foundational"* course, scheduled for March 2025!


Please find the attached brochure


*Benefits on enrollment *



   - 50% AWS exam voucher will be provided to students
   - Full access to all modules of AWS LMS and Hands-on lab.
   - Exam preparation material with Mock exam




*Benefits of AWS Certification*


There are numerous advantages to becoming AWS certified. Amazon Web
Services certifications‚Ä¶



   - Validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing
   platform.
   - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications
   worldwide.
   - Garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages
   once hired.
   - Are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech
   credentials.
   - Demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career
   path.
   - Provide access to a network of like-minded peers and AWS
    thought-leaders.
   - Require recertification which ensures that your AWS skills remain
   current.


Interested students are requested to register themselves using the
following link:

*Registration for Cloud Practitioner Foundational**: *Click Here!!
<https://forms.gle/EAo4zLYKoBKGmc7N9>

Registration is open till next week (22 March 2023)

*Respective faculty members are requested to circulate this to students
in your respective Institute / Branch.*


For any Query contact

Prof. Sanket Suthar (CSPIT-IT)

sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dr. Parth Shah (CSPIT-IT)

parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in

--

column1: 329,19588e3e1c11a103,19588e3e1c11a103,Sanket Suthar <sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in>,AWS Academy Registration for ""Cloud Practitioner Foundational""- March 2025"
from: Dear All, We're excited to announce the upcoming batch of the AWS Academy's "Cloud Practitioner Foundational" course, scheduled for March 2025! Please find the attached brochure
subject:
*Dear All, *


We're excited to announce the upcoming batch of the AWS Academy's *"Cloud
Practitioner Foundational"* course, scheduled for March 2025!


Please find the attached brochure


*Benefits on enrollment *



   - 50% AWS exam voucher will be provided to students
   - Full access to all modules of AWS LMS and Hands-on lab.
   - Exam preparation material with Mock exam




*Benefits of AWS Certification*


There are numerous advantages to becoming AWS certified. Amazon Web
Services certifications‚Ä¶



   - Validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing
   platform.
   - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications
   worldwide.
   - Garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages
   once hired.
   - Are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech
   credentials.
   - Demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career
   path.
   - Provide access to a network of like-minded peers and AWS
    thought-leaders.
   - Require recertification which ensures that your AWS skills remain
   current.


Interested students are requested to register themselves using the
following link:

*Registration for Cloud Practitioner Foundational**: *Click Here!!
<https://forms.gle/EAo4zLYKoBKGmc7N9>

Registration is open till next week (22 March 2023)

*Respective faculty members are requested to circulate this to students
in your respective Institute / Branch.*


For any Query contact

Prof. Sanket Suthar (CSPIT-IT)

sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dr. Parth Shah (CSPIT-IT)

parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in

--

Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF) Awards 2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dr. Kirti Makwana <kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Mar 10, 2025 at 9:35 AM Subject: Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Kirti Makwana <kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Mar 10, 2025 at 9:35‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF)
Awards 2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
To: <24dcse@charusat.edu.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 9:27‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF)
Awards 2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: FICCI FRAMES <frames@ficci.com>
Date: Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 4:41‚ÄØPM
Subject: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF) Awards
2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
To: principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in <principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in>



Dear Academician,

Greetings from FICCI!

*We are pleased to invite students from your Institute/ University to send
their entries for BAF Awards 2025 across various categories - Animation,
Visual Effects (VFX), Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality (AVGC-XR).* This
is a unique opportunity for aspiring creators to gain national recognition
and showcase their talent amongst industry veterans, studios, and
decision-makers.

*Best Animated Frames (BAF) Awards ceremony will take place on March 27,
2025, at Sofitel, Mumbai.*

*Award Categories for Students:*

   - Best Student Short Film (2D & 3D Animation)
   - Best Student Character Design
   - Best Student Game Design & Development
   - Best Student Visual Effects (VFX) Project
   - Best Student Comic or Graphic Novel
   - Best Student XR (AR/VR/MR) Experience


*Why should Students participate in BAF Awards 2025?*
‚úî Gain National Recognition ‚Äì Showcase your work to industry leaders and
global experts.
‚úî Engage with Top Creators ‚Äì Network with leading animation, gaming, and
VFX professionals.
‚úî Get Industry Insights ‚Äì Attend thought-provoking sessions on the latest
AVGC-XR trends.
‚úî Win Prestigious Awards ‚Äì Boost your career prospects with a BAF
Award-winning portfolio.
‚úî Showcase at FICCI FRAMES ‚Äì Your work could be featured at India‚Äôs biggest
M&E industry platform.

*Judging Criteria:*
A distinguished jury panel comprising renowned animators, game developers,
VFX supervisors, and industry experts will evaluate the entries based on
creativity, technical execution, and storytelling impact. Winning entries
will receive trophies, certificates, and industry-wide recognition,
providing an unparalleled boost to emerging talent.

*Timeline and Process:*

   - Submit your entries *before March 15, 2025* at
*https://registrations.ficci.com/baf/baf-reg-online.asp
   <https://post.spmailtechnolo.com/f/a/50Mh_Ln6TQ5haliEm6dp4g~~/AAUvfxA~/2qiZh96vMLcNGup3r4X4MBhkc5uqHDaC9M-6oC8AxK7lorIMn4tHtvpAJshlAn_--yWMHD_eBUW1QpoHDhWvbCYTT4ffD5wriwsjbKEqAzrOd_KH_K6zEip92hHztUhgW0WhLQK7NAFh8WH_xAxjkCt3if2uvE84e1S-AV4bD_EPlkr5BRJoDADOtKQ61SUfhZRQXW-JQsQ1gs2F7UE82_LhjCoIMqJ7tEE2CUFiJ5tOZeWAq5t2FiMdxRWtn4vr>*
   - Visit *https://baf.ficci.in/
   <https://post.spmailtechnolo.com/f/a/t8vQ488VXAeUxrKRa4n7HQ~~/AAUvfxA~/2qiZh96vMLcNGup3r4X4MBhkc5uqHDaC9M-6oC8AxK7lorIMn4tHtvpAJshlAn_--yWMHD_eBUW1QpoHDhWvbCYTT4ffD5wriwsjbKEqAzqelZwdlL1VG7N5jxd20VJ405R8cxEQAuZAftV2GercZl3IG1AVwjH_zBRxvsupLZ25mnP9KPvfQ7NSKYaznBw8Le7NgnZZGEGiXOMfF6afGsJF75B5zMmKREK2-0g7cwp4mqC6jIb9Uy8gWclICkWe>*

For queries, contact Ms. Pratibha Sharma at *pratibha.sharma@ficci.com
<https://post.spmailtechnolo.com/f/a/2TeVTq_Y8j8LyZbgFear1A~~/AAUvfxA~/2qiZh96vMLcNGup3r4X4MBhkc5uqHDaC9M-6oC8AxK7lorIMn4tHtvpAJshlAn_--yWMHD_eBUW1QpoHDhWvbCYTT4ffD5wriwsjbKEqAzo-Al3YPDE298QKfm28tgBCk9zyOrjjNWK5CfOUSFUPn-dsTOW4uh9-Czg7wFcLt3fkHX3PF0FQBxsbDxnh0GjZR800KOyADsOvsINlxNHJSFRC8IcEV-luzWPhrBI90vfcvPTytqemOAFVIxYaO1r->*
| +91 8800434844.



We look forward to celebrating the creative brilliance at BAF Awards 2025!


Warm Regards,

*Leena Jaisani*
Deputy Secretary General & Cluster Head ‚Äì Media & Entertainment, Retail,
FMCG, E-Commerce, IPR, Cascade and Young Leaders Forum

subject: Re: Important: CHARUSAT - Teaching of a Course on Liberal Arts - Academic Year 2024-25 || March 25-28, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, With the aspiration to be a World Class University, Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) has initiated various constructive actions for holistic development of
content:
Dear Students,


With the aspiration to be a *World Class University*, Charotar University
of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) has initiated various constructive
actions for holistic development of students of the University.



*Courses on Liberal Arts* offered by *Department of Humanities and Social
Sciences* *(HSS)* under *Faculty of Humanities (FoH)* to all the students
of *Second semester* of all constituent institutes of CHARUSAT is one of
them.



*With the kind cooperation and support of all the constituent institutes
and Departments of CHARUSAT*, courses on Liberal Arts have been taught to
the students in Workshop Mode, consistently for TEN fruitful years wherein
courses like ‚Äì *Painting, Photography, Sculpting, Pottery and Ceramic Art,
Media and Graphic Design,** Art & Craft, Contemporary Dance *and
*Dramatics* are
offered to students. Along with these courses, additional courses like *Music
(Vocal), **Music (Instrumental- Tabla**, Guitar, **Harmonium, Flute**,
Indian Classical Dance ‚Äì Kathak and **Bharatnatyam* are to be offered to
the students from this academic year.



Anticipating the same support and cooperation, this Academic year (2024-25)
in Even Semester, the Courses on Liberal Arts are scheduled to be offered
in Workshop Mode from *March 25 to 28, 2025.* Workshop kits for the
students will be distributed on* March 24, 2025* (from 9:30 am to 4:00 pm)
in different slots at Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday.
Every Institute/Department will be intimated about their slots.


Kindly book these dates and plan other activities accordingly.


* Information Points for the Students*


   1. The Courses of Liberal Arts will be offered / conducted in a *Workshop
   Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* on all the *FOUR days* i.e. *March 25-28,
   2025.*
   2. Each course of Liberal Arts is a 2 Credit Course.
   3. *Students are required to collect a Kit*. It will be available at
   Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on *Monday - March 24,
2025* *(from
   9:30 am to 4:00 pm)* in different slots. Every Institute/Department will
   be intimated about their slots
   4. Students must bring the Kit everyday and take care of the materials
   and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
   students will be required to manage it.
   5. *100% Attendance is Compulsory*.
   6. Students need to report in Time (at least *10 minutes before* the
   stipulated time).
   7. They must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned to them.
   8. As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
   required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
   university and professional programs.
   9. It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
   10. During the Workshop, students‚Äô submissions will also be taken.
   11. *Internal as well as External Evaluation will be carried out during
   those days.*
   12. Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
   other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
   via email.

In case of any query kindly contact Mr. Arpit Bhatt / Mr. Hardik Parmar.
Thanks & Regards,

*Mr. Hardik Parmar*
Assistant Professor,
Department of Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),

--

content:
Dear Students,

Your tutorial (Practice Session for MSUD102) will commence on *March 18,
2025*. This session is part of *continuous evaluation*, and your attendance
is *mandatory*.

*If you are absent for even one session, we will inform your parents*.
Please ensure your participation to avoid any issues.

 Each class has been divided into *two equal partitions*, and sessions will
be conducted by *two different faculty members*. Please *check your ID

subject: Invitation to Participate in Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025
snippet: Dear Students, The CHARUSAT NSS Cell is pleased to invite you to participate in the Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025, an incredible opportunity to express your vision for a developed India. This
content:
Dear Students,

The *CHARUSAT NSS Cell* is pleased to invite you to participate in the *Viksit
Bharat Youth Parliament 2025*, an incredible opportunity to express your
vision for a developed India. This initiative, supported by the *Ministry
of Youth Affairs & Sports, Govt. of India*, encourages youth engagement in
policy discussions and leadership development.
*Event Details:*

*District-Level Competition:* 17th March 2025
*Venue:* Sardar Patel University, Vallabh Vidyanagar

*Register Here:* https://mybharat.gov.in/ -> Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament
2025 <https://mybharat.gov.in/mega_events/viksit-bharat-youth-parliament>
(*Register as soon as possible!*)
*Deadline : 16th March 2025*
*Participation Guidelines:*

   - Open to students aged *18-25 years*.
   - Submit a *1-minute video* on the topic: *"What does Viksit Bharat mean
   to you?"*
   - Language options: *Gujarati, Hindi, or English*.
   - *Selected 150 participants* will compete at the District Level.
   - *Top 10* will advance to the State Level, and winners will qualify for
   the *National Level* competition.

For detailed guidelines and further information, please find the *attached
PDF*.

*We encourage all eligible students to take advantage of this opportunity
and make CHARUSAT proud! *

For any queries, feel free to contact the *CHARUSAT **NSS Cell*.
-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 9:27 AM Subject: Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 9:27‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF)
Awards 2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: FICCI FRAMES <frames@ficci.com>
Date: Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 4:41‚ÄØPM
Subject: Call for Student Entries ‚Äì FICCI Best Animated Frames (BAF) Awards
2025 | Send entries latest by 15 March 2025
To: principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in <principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in>



Dear Academician,

Greetings from FICCI!

*We are pleased to invite students from your Institute/ University to send
their entries for BAF Awards 2025 across various categories - Animation,
Visual Effects (VFX), Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality (AVGC-XR).* This
is a unique opportunity for aspiring creators to gain national recognition
and showcase their talent amongst industry veterans, studios, and
decision-makers.

*Best Animated Frames (BAF) Awards ceremony will take place on March 27,
2025, at Sofitel, Mumbai.*

*Award Categories for Students:*

   - Best Student Short Film (2D & 3D Animation)
   - Best Student Character Design
   - Best Student Game Design & Development
   - Best Student Visual Effects (VFX) Project
   - Best Student Comic or Graphic Novel
   - Best Student XR (AR/VR/MR) Experience


*Why should Students participate in BAF Awards 2025?*
‚úî Gain National Recognition ‚Äì Showcase your work to industry leaders and
global experts.
‚úî Engage with Top Creators ‚Äì Network with leading animation, gaming, and
VFX professionals.
‚úî Get Industry Insights ‚Äì Attend thought-provoking sessions on the latest
AVGC-XR trends.
‚úî Win Prestigious Awards ‚Äì Boost your career prospects with a BAF
Award-winning portfolio.
‚úî Showcase at FICCI FRAMES ‚Äì Your work could be featured at India‚Äôs biggest
M&E industry platform.

*Judging Criteria:*
A distinguished jury panel comprising renowned animators, game developers,
VFX supervisors, and industry experts will evaluate the entries based on
creativity, technical execution, and storytelling impact. Winning entries
will receive trophies, certificates, and industry-wide recognition,
providing an unparalleled boost to emerging talent.

*Timeline and Process:*

   - Submit your entries *before March 15, 2025* at
*https://registrations.ficci.com/baf/baf-reg-online.asp

subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat Hackathon
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 9:29 AM Subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 9:29‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



Please motivate students. If any type of assistants is required, feel free
to contact HoDs or to me.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <info@gujgov.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 12:42‚ÄØAM
Subject: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear,,

The Education Department, Gujarat has been doing persistent efforts to
institutionalize the Innovation & Startup Ecosystem in the State through
policy, platform, and processes. To augment the support system for
nurturing student Start-ups in the State, second edition of Student
Start-up and Innovation Policy (SSIP 2.0) was launched on 05 January 2022.

Under the Policy, various flagship initiatives have been envisaged through
which youth can get adequate opportunities to harness their creative
potential. We have pioneered various Open Innovation Programmes like
hackathon and executed them at a large-scale.

The 6th Edition of ‚ÄúSmart Gujarat Hackathon‚Äù with special focus on
Artificial will be a step forward towards building smart and sustainable
solutions to complex challenges. In this edition of hackathon around 15,000
students are expected to participate and work on problem statements.
Challenges from various departments of the State Government, Public Sector
Undertakings, Municipal Corporations, District Collectorate, District
Panchayats and industries will be broadcasted to students across
universities, institutes, and schools.

The program will feature problem statements from various sectors providing
students with ample opportunities to engage in Artificial Intelligence and
other emerging technology-based solution- oriented projects. Moreover,
winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable
mentorship support from nodal officers of government departments and
benefits from education department of Government of Gujarat, further
encouraging their pursuit of innovation and excellence.

We request all students from your institute to actively participate in 6th
edition of ‚ÄúSmart Gujarat Hackathon‚Äù. This event presents a fantastic
opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving skills and
innovative thinking. To get more details and further update regarding
registration process and list of sectors students can visit the following
link: https://ssipgujarat.in/hackathon. Teams must select a problem
statement online after registration and login in the portal.

Last date for Team registration is 10th March 2025 and synopsis Submission
is 14th March 2025.

Kindly share this with all your students and faculty members so that they
can participate in this event. For any query, please revert us at
ssipgujarat@gmail.com





*Team HackathonStudent Start-up and Innovation PolicyEducation Department,
Government of Gujarat3rd Floor, Block No:2 ,Karmayogi BhavanSector 10-A
382010*


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

>
>
> Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing
>
> Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT
>
> Dear Students and Faculty members,
>
> We are excited to invite you to a two-day hands-on workshop on High
> Performance Computing (HPC) at CHARUSAT. This workshop will provide you
> with practical experience in parallel computing techniques and technologies.
> *Workshop Details:*
>
> üìÖ Date: 11-12 March 2025
>
> üìç Venue: 323A, A6 Building
>
> üë• Maximum participants: 40
>
> üí∞ Registration: Free of cost
>
> *Note:* E-certificates will be provided to participants with 100%
> attendance and 100% allocated task submission.
> About the Workshop
>
> This workshop will introduce you to the Supercomputing Facility at
> CSPIT-CHARUSAT. You'll gain hands-on experience with various parallel
> computing paradigms including:
>
>    - ‚Ä¢ GPU Programming with CUDA
>    - ‚Ä¢ Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
>    - ‚Ä¢ Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
>    - ‚Ä¢ Multi-GPU training with PyTorch
>
> Workshop Schedule
> Time Day 1 (March 11) Day 2 (March 12)
> 9:10 AM - 10:00 AM Super computing in action - Transforming Science and
> Innovation
> Dr. Amit Thakkar
> 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
> Dr. Ritesh Patel GPU Programming with CUDA (continued)
> Dr. Ritesh Patel
> 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Lunch Break Lunch Break
> 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP (continued)
> Dr. Ritesh Patel Multi-GPU training with PyTorch
> Mr. Harshal Yagnik
> 2:00 PM - 4:20 PM Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
> Mr. Harshal Yagnik Multi-GPU training with PyTorch (continued)
> Mr. Harshal Yagnik
> Benefits
>
>    - ‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with the Supercomputing Facility
>    - ‚Ä¢ Learn from experts in the field of high-performance computing
>    - ‚Ä¢ E-certificates for participants with 100% attendance and task
>    completion
>    - ‚Ä¢ Valuable skills for research and industry applications
>
> Registration Information
>
> The workshop is open to all students and faculty members. Registration is
> required as seats are limited to 40 participants.
>
> Limited seats available - Register today!
> Register Now <#m_-1425002374574594206_m_-8735407115577644845_>
>
> Registration closes on March 9, 2025 or when all seats are filled
>
> Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club |
> CSPIT-CHARUSAT
>
> "EMPOWERING THE POTENTIAL OF PARALLEL COMPUTING"
>
>
> With Regards,
>

subject: Fwd: Hands on Workshop on HIgh Performance Computing under Super Computing Facility @ CHARUSAT
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Amit Thakkar <amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 11:55 AM Subject: Hands on Workshop on HIgh Performance Computing under Super
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amit Thakkar <amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 11:55‚ÄØAM
Subject: Hands on Workshop on HIgh Performance Computing under Super
Computing Facility @ CHARUSAT
To: <21cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <22cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <
23cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>,
Dean FTE CHARUSAT <dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, CE CSPIT <ce.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, IT <
it@charusat.ac.in>, AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>, CSE CSPIT <
cse@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Ritesh Patel <
riteshpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Harshul Yagnik <
harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in>


Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT

Dear Students and Faculty members,

We are excited to invite you to a two-day hands-on workshop on High
Performance Computing (HPC) at CHARUSAT. This workshop will provide you
with practical experience in parallel computing techniques and technologies.
*Workshop Details:*

üìÖ Date: 11-12 March 2025

üìç Venue: 323A, A6 Building

üë• Maximum participants: 40

üí∞ Registration: Free of cost

*Note:* E-certificates will be provided to participants with 100%
attendance and 100% allocated task submission.
About the Workshop

This workshop will introduce you to the Supercomputing Facility at
CSPIT-CHARUSAT. You'll gain hands-on experience with various parallel
computing paradigms including:

   - ‚Ä¢ GPU Programming with CUDA
   - ‚Ä¢ Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
   - ‚Ä¢ Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
   - ‚Ä¢ Multi-GPU training with PyTorch

Workshop Schedule
Time Day 1 (March 11) Day 2 (March 12)
9:10 AM - 10:00 AM Super computing in action - Transforming Science and
Innovation
Dr. Amit Thakkar
10:00 AM - 12:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
Dr. Ritesh Patel GPU Programming with CUDA (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel
12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Lunch Break Lunch Break
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel Multi-GPU training with PyTorch
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
2:00 PM - 4:20 PM Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
Mr. Harshal Yagnik Multi-GPU training with PyTorch (continued)
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
Benefits

   - ‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with the Supercomputing Facility
   - ‚Ä¢ Learn from experts in the field of high-performance computing
   - ‚Ä¢ E-certificates for participants with 100% attendance and task
   completion
   - ‚Ä¢ Valuable skills for research and industry applications

Registration Information

The workshop is open to all students and faculty members. Registration is
required as seats are limited to 40 participants.

Limited seats available - Register today!
Register Now <#m_-8735407115577644845_>

Registration closes on March 9, 2025 or when all seats are filled

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club |
CSPIT-CHARUSAT

"EMPOWERING THE POTENTIAL OF PARALLEL COMPUTING"


With Regards,

Amit Thakkar, Ph.D.
Professor & Head
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT)
Charotar University of Science & Technology.(CHARUSAT)
Jay Swaminarayan.
