subject: Fwd: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - World‚Äôs No. 1 Ethical Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (March 2025)
snippet: Dear students, We are glad to inform you that "Charotar University of Science and Technology - CHARUSAT" is the official EC-Council Academia Partner since January 2020. We are immensely
content:
Dear students,

We are glad to inform you that *"Charotar University of Science and
Technology - CHARUSAT"* is the official *EC-Council Academia Partner *since
January 2020. We are immensely pleased to welcome ‚ÄúCHARUSAT‚Äù *students* to
EC Council's newly launched *CEHv13* program. Certified Ethical
Hacker CEHv13
<https://www.eccouncil.org/programs/certified-ethical-hacker-ceh/> will
teach you the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and
methodologies hackers and information security professionals use to hack an
organization lawfully. *110+ students have benefited from CEH at CHARUSAT
with a subsidized academia kit price.*

*What‚Äôs new in CEHv13?*: *From the creators of Certified Ethical Hacker
(CEH) comes the latest and evolved version 13 with added AI capabilities.
Structured across 20 learning modules covering over 550 attack techniques,
CEH provides cybersecurity professionals with the core knowledge they need
to detect and defend against emerging threats.*

*You will get:*

   - EC-Council Official Course Book for CEHv13 for self-study (24 Months) -
   Accessible Online/Offline. To Download App
   <https://support.vitalsource.com/hc/en-us/articles/201344733-Bookshelf-Download-Options>

   - Access To iLabs for 6 Months. Check the ilabs Demo Here:
   *https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI* <https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI>.
   - An Exam Voucher (1 Year) - *Get a globally recognized certificate
for* passing
   the exam. Accreditations
   <https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fwww.eccouncil.org%2faccreditations%2f&c=E,1,hLej6Kb3ZRL_QKhhm71kedMm89bbj8UclU3d50zuCt2frG_t19Fir_60SvUk16RJBGYXwVBLF11HLMhr7nDv8WGkPElWNiTm9zdZ_xfo&typo=1>
   - Over 200 hands-on labs with Over 3,500 hacking tools. Learn how to
   hack multiple operating systems (Windows 11, Windows servers, Linux,
   Ubuntu, Android)
   - The venue of the Exam will be our University Premises.

*Popular Cybersecurity Tools in the Course:*


* - Network scanning and mapping tools (e.g., Nmap, hping3)- Vulnerability
assessment tools (e.g., OpenVAS, Nessus)- Penetration testing tools (e.g.,
Metasploit, Aircrack-ng)- Packet sniffers and network analyzers (e.g.,
Wireshark, Omnipeek Network Analyzer)- Social engineering tools (e.g.,
Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET), SpeedPhish Framework (SPF))- Password
cracking tools (e.g., John the Ripper, L0phtCrack)- Forensics tools (e.g.
FTK, EnCase, Autopsy)- Wireless hacking tools (e.g., Aircrack-ng,
Wifiphisher)- Encryption tools (e.g., CryptoForge, VeraCrypt)*
*Master AI to automate ethical hacking tasks and hack and defend against AI
systems.*

*‚Ä¢ ShellGPT* ‚Äì Automates various reconnaissance and penetration testing
tasks using AI-driven scripting.
*‚Ä¢ ChatGPT *‚Äì Helps generate code, automate tasks, and create scripts for
ethical hacking.
‚Ä¢ *FraudGPT* ‚Äì Simulates AI-assisted malicious activities to learn defense
strategies.
‚Ä¢ *WormGPT* ‚Äì An offensive AI tool used to simulate exploitations and
malware creation.
‚Ä¢ *DeepExploit* ‚Äì AI-powered vulnerability scanning and exploitation tool.
‚Ä¢ *Nebula* ‚Äì Automates network discovery and vulnerability identification
with AI.
‚Ä¢ *Veed.io* ‚Äì Can visualize security analytics and post-exploitation
results for better reporting.


*Typical Job Roles for C|EH :*

   - Mid-Level Information Security Auditor
   - Cybersecurity Auditor
   - Security Administrator
   - IT Security Administrator
   - Cyber Defense Analyst
   - Senior Security Consultant
   - Information Security Manager
   - Senior SOC Analyst
   - Solution Architect
   - Cybersecurity Consultant



   - Vulnerability Assessment Analyst
   - Warning Analyst
   - Information Security Analyst 1
   - Security Analyst L1
   - Infosec Security Administrator
   - Cybersecurity Analyst L1, L2, & L3
   - Network Security Engineer
   - SOC Security Analyst
   - Security Analyst
   - Network Engineer

*Webinar on "A Career in Cybersecurity" by EC-Council with Collaboration of
CHARUSAT | Campus Official: *https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-QgxO3JhlA


*Testimonials:*

   - How Certified Ethical Hacker Helped Me Land a Job with Big4 | Sidhant
   Gupta <https://youtu.be/PLvVyh96n8M?si=IVLEptb5F-QPMUaw>
   - Catch Your Big Break in Cybersecurity with C|EH | Ravina Joshi
   <https://youtu.be/TO7veOnV9T4?si=uzHTokSpVAtp1iOm>
   - How C|EH Helped Me Build a Successful Career in Cybersecurity
   <https://youtu.be/SZ8tmKzyBh4?si=TZpSsdfrCeZf2I2j>


*Cost for CHARUSAT Students only:*

   - *We* communicated and requested *the EC-Council for the same, and they
   are ready to provide a *subsidized academia kit* for CHARUSAT
   students at a *reduced cost as per the options below.

Dear EOC Coordinators,

I hope you are doing well.

The *EOC activity scheduled for 7th March* has been *cancelled* due to
the *Annual
Day celebrations*. It will now be conducted *after the Holi vacation*, and
the new date will be shared soon.

I kindly request you to inform the students in your respective departments
about this update. Your support in conveying this information would be
greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your cooperation.


*Thanks & Regards,*
Gaurav Kumar
Assistant Professor
Department of Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AIML)
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT)
Charotar University of Science & Technology.(CHARUSAT)

snippet: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT, Changa ---------- Forwarded message
content:
Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Sagar Chokshi <sagarchokshi.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, 5 Mar 2025, 5:39 pm
Subject: MEUD101 EOE Midterm Syllabus
To: <24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <24ec@charusat.edu.in>,
<24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Vikas Panchal <vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in>, Radhika Patel <
radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Satayu Travadi <satayutravadi@gmail.com>,
Anand Patel <anandpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Mr. Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>





Dear Students,
Please find the syllabus below for the *MEUD101 EOE Midterm Exam*. The
detailed points for chapters/units: 3,6 & 10, you can find it from the FY
Handbook/Syllabus booklet.

*1. Fundamentals of Engineering Drawing*
Importance of engineering drawing, drawing instruments and materials, BIS
and ISO
Different types of lines used in engineering practice, methods of
projections as per SP 46-1988.
Engineering scale.
Title block, Types of line, Geometric construction,Dimensioning System
*3. Orthographic Projection*
*6. Introduction of Mechanical Engineering*
*10. Scope of Civil Engineering*
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),
ACCREDITED WITH ‚Äú*A+*‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC
Education Campus Changa -388421
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist: Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph.No. +91-2697-265329; Mob. No. +91-9726622007.

subject: Fwd: Free Consultation for women & heavy discount in Mammography
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Charusat Hospital <coo.ch@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, 5 Mar, 2025, 12:53 pm Subject: Free Consultation for women & heavy discount in Mammography To
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Charusat Hospital <coo.ch@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, 5 Mar, 2025, 12:53‚ÄØpm
Subject: Free Consultation for women & heavy discount in Mammography
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,
International Women's day fall on 08/03/25.
It gives us immense pleasure to announce that from the day of
"International Women's day" i e from  08/03/25 to 31/03/25 CHARUSAT
Hospital is passing the following benefits to the women.

1) THERE WILL NOT BE ANY CONSULTATION CHARGES IN O.P.D. FOR WOMEN FROM
08/03/25 TILL 31/03/25 ON ALL THE WORKING DAYS.

2) THERE WILL BE 70% DISCOUNT in the CHARGES FOR THE MAMMOGRAPHY, WHICH
WILL BE ONLY Rs 300/- INSTEAD OF Rs 1000/-.

So please circulate this message to the maximum number of your staff and
students so that they can take advantage of these schemes.

Dr Jagan Mazmudar
CHARUSAT HOSPITAL

--

subject: Re: Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR
content:
*Dear Students,*


*Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai
Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of
Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)*



*You are requested to send the filled form with documents received from the
eligible students latest by 28th march 2025.*

*CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*



 NOTICE


*Date: 05/03/2025*


Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel
Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate
Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)



This is for information to all the concerned students that Bhupendrabhai
Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means
Scholarship will be awarded to Undergraduate program Student of *DEPSTAR *for
academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:
Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:



v  The Student of F Y B Tech whose 12th Standard result is more than 70
Percentage & family income is not more than Rs. 7 lacs will be eligible to
apply

v  To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has to
secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every Year without a backlog.

v  In case, a student will not score a minimum 7.00 CGPA in a consecutive
Year, then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student.

v  Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
apply.

v  The Scholarship will be awarded to maximum one eligible student of
DEPSTAR



*The forms for the scholarship are available and is to be submitted as
per following details:*



*Name of Institute*

*Forms to be collected from*

DEPSTAR

Mr. Dharmendra Patel



*Last Date of Submission of Form: 25.03.2025*





**Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*
Thanks & Regards,

*Mr. Hardik Parmar*
Assistant Professor,
Department of Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),

--

subject: Important Email: Clarification on Syllabus and Reading Material
snippet: Dear Students, In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the following reading material for Unit 2 and
content:
Dear Students,

In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns
about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the
following reading material for *Unit 2* and *Unit 5* to verify the
syllabus. Do not get confused.

   - *Unit 2:* Up to *Subsection 2.2* (*Complementary Functions and Their
   Examples*). Please check *Subsection 2.2* in this reading material.
   - *Unit 5:* Only *Section 5.3* (*Evaluation of Double Integrals and Its
   Examples*), *excluding Sections 5.1 and 5.2*.  Please check *Subsection
   5.3* in this reading material

If you still have any doubts, feel free to contact me.

Best regards,

subject: Insights from Continuous Evaluation Analysis Report: Problem-Based Assessment in Programming with C++ subject
snippet: Dear Students, As a subject teacher, we would like to share insights from the recent Continuous Internal Evaluation (CIE) conducted for the subject CEUC102 ‚Äì Programming with C++ in the 2nd semester.
content:
Dear Students,

As a subject teacher, we would like to share insights from the recent
*Continuous
Internal Evaluation (CIE)* conducted for the subject *CEUC102 ‚Äì Programming
with C++* in the 2nd semester. The evaluation was designed using a
*Problem-Based
Assessment (PBA) evaluation pedagogy* aligned with *Bloom‚Äôs Taxonomy*. The
attached report provides a detailed analysis of the outcomes.
*This evaluation methodology emphasized problem-solving, critical thinking,
and application of concepts, rather than rote memorization.*
*The feedback was also collected from you after conducting a CIE and you
expressed a positive perception of this evaluation pedagogy.* You recognize
the relevance of these problem-solving exercises to real-world programming
tasks and appreciate how such assessments prepare them for future
challenges. This is particularly encouraging as you are only in the 2nd
semester, and early exposure to problem-based learning will make them
mature and confident problem solvers in the coming years.

In today‚Äôs era of GenAI/LLMs, the ability to think critically, solve
complex problems, and apply concepts creatively is the key to success.
Through this pedagogical approach, we are equipping you with the skills
necessary to thrive in a rapidly evolving technological landscape.

*Attached is the evaluation analysis report for your reference. You are
requested to go through it.*

Thank you.

-- 
Regards,
Dr. Parth Goel
Assistant Professor,
Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research(DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
[*ACCREDITED WITH "A+" GRADE BY NAAC, GOI*],
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist:Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph. No: 02697-265060, Ext. No. : 5297
https://parthgoelblog.wordpress.com/

--

subject: Re: Notification of Syllabus for Mid-Term Exam 2025 for CSUC101
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly note the syllabus for Mid-Term exam 2025 for course Digital Electronics -CSUC101 is as follows: Unit 1: Number Systems: Different Radix Number Systems, Number base conversions,
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly note the syllabus for *Mid-Term exam 2025* for course *Digital
Electronics -CSUC101* is as follows:

*Unit 1: Number Systems:*
Different Radix Number Systems, Number base conversions, Complements,
Signed and Unsigned Numbers, Digital arithmetic (Binary Addition and
Subtraction (normal and with complements)), Binary codes, Code Conversion,
Binary Logic and Logic Gates

*Unit 2:  Simplification of Boolean functions:  *
Boolean Algebra (Basic Definitions, Axioms, Postulates and Theorem, Boolean
functions: Canonical and Standard Form, Maxterm and Minterm, SOP and POS),
Simplification of Boolean functions using Boolean theorems and postulates,
Simplification of Boolean functions using K-map (up to 4  variable K-map),
Realize logic circuit using Basic gates and Universal gates

*Unit 3: Combinational Circuits:*
Design Procedure, Half Adder, Half Subtractor, Full Adder

All the Best for the Exam

>
--

Dr. Kirti Makwana

subject: ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Recruitments '25
snippet: Thanks for filling out ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Recruitments '25 Here's what was received. ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Recruitments '25 Welcome to Arthyantra - a dynamic platform where students from
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Recruitments '25
Here's what was received.


ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Recruitments '25

Welcome to Arthyantra - a dynamic platform where students from diverse  
academic backgrounds converge to explore the exciting intersections of  
economics, entrepreneurship, and technology-driven innovation. Our mission  
is to cultivate a vibrant community where members engage in  
thought-provoking discussions, gain insights from industry experts, and  
explore avenues for personal and professional growth.

We bridge the gap between theory and practice, offering tailored activities  
that deepen understanding of economic principles while nurturing  
entrepreneurial spirit and innovation.

Join us in driving our mission forward! If you're passionate about  
economics, finance, or business, and want to make a difference, this is  
your chance to be a part of something meaningful.

Please fill out the form by 1st March 2025 to express your interest in  
joining our core team. We look forward to welcoming you aboard!


Your email (24dcs011@charusat.edu.in) was recorded when you submitted this  
form.


Full Name *


Priyanshi Dalwadi


Enrollment Id *


24DCS011


CHARUSAT Email Id *


24dcs011@charusat.ed.in


Institute *


DEPSTAR



Course *


CSE


Year *


1st year


2nd year


3rd year


4th year


Phone No. *


9106697428


Which team are you willing to join ?
*


Public relations


Marketing and networking


Sponsorship


Content writer


Content creator


Video editing


Social Media Manager


Share any previous experience you have gained until now.


I have actively engaged with academic and extracurricular communities by  
joining clubs like Quantix: The Quant And Consulting Club and the Ramanujan  
Society of Research (RaSoR) at IITM, which exposed me to analytical  
discussions and innovative thinking in economics and business. I  
volunteered at AWS SCD last semester (September 2024), where I developed  
teamwork and communication skills. In addition to that, my active  
participation in several school literary events has helped me refine my  
writing and creative expression.


What qualities do you possess that would make you a suitable candidate for  
this role? *


I posses both, interest and passion for literature and economics, making me  
a strong candidate for this role. My love for literature is evident in my  
habits of journaling, avid reading, and even dabbling in poetry, all of  
which have helped me develop a distinctive narrative style. Experiences  
like representing my school at literary events, along with active  
participation in academic clubs and volunteer work, have further refined my  
ability to break down complex ideas into engaging, clear content. These  
qualities make me a natural fit for a role that values both creativity and  
precision.


Why do you want to join ARTHYANTRA? *


I'm excited to join ARTHYANTRA because it offers a hands-on opportunity to  
immerse myself in the unique blend of economics, entrepreneurship, and tech  
innovation. As someone passionate about crafting compelling narratives, I'm  
eager to leverage my creative communication skills to capture the club's  
essence. I view this club as a great opportunity for valuable exposure and  
growth alongside like-minded peers.


Do you want to share anything else you think would be helpful for us to  
know about you?


In addition to my active interests in literature and its diverse  
expressions, I am currently pursuing a dual degree in BTech Computer  
Science (CHARUSAT, on campus) and BS in Data Science & Application (IIT  
Madras, online program). This academic journey not only strengthens my  
technical foundation but also enriches my perspective on innovative  
problem-solving and content creation. I believe this unique combination of  
technical skills will allow me to contribute effectively to ARTHYANTRA's  
mission.


Thank you for filling out this form. We will notify you for your respective  
interviews.

For any queries please contact:

Vansh Malani (9023046891) (Team member)

Nandini Sherwani(9265737966) (Team Member)


Mithil Mistry (8238326605)(President)

Hasti Vakani (9374615759)(President)

Rana Harmin (7046255281)(Advisor)

subject: Fwd: „Äê2 days left„ÄëRegister for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 9:17 AM Subject: Fwd: „Äê2 days left„ÄëRegister for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 9:17‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: „Äê2 days left„ÄëRegister for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon
for Solving Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIEC IIT Gandhinagar <iiec@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Feb 26, 2025 at 7:57‚ÄØPM
Subject: „Äê2 days left„ÄëRegister for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for
Solving Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To:


Dear friends and Innovators,


Greetings from the IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
(IIEC)!


We are thrilled to invite you to *Hack the Future 2025: Innovating
Intelligent Data Insights*, a national-level hackathon organized by IIEC,
IIT Gandhinagar, in collaboration with the *Ministry of Statistics and
Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India*.


This *36-hour immersive challenge*, scheduled for *March 21‚Äì23, 2025*, at
IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, will bring together developers, designers,
innovators, and students to leverage *AI and data science* in addressing
critical socio-economic and development challenges using publicly available
data.



*Why Participate?*

‚úÖ *Solve Real-World Problems:* Tackle challenges curated by MoSPI,
Government of India, and contribute to meaningful solutions.
üèÜ *Win Exciting Prizes:*

   - *1st Place:* ‚Çπ2,50,000
   - *2nd Place:* ‚Çπ1,50,000
   - *3rd Place:* ‚Çπ1,00,000
   - *2 Special Mentions:* ‚Çπ35,000 each
   üöÄ *Incubation & Piloting Opportunities:* Selected projects may be
   incubated at IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, and piloted in collaboration with MoSPI.
   üöÄ *Network & Learn:* Connect with industry experts, policymakers, and
   fellow innovators to expand your horizons.


*Key Dates*

üìÖ *Application Window:* February 7‚Äì28, 2025
üì¢ *Shortlisted Participants Announced:* March 5, 2025
üí° *Hackathon & Pitching Event:* March 21‚Äì23, 2025


If you are passionate about *AI, data science, and innovation*, this is
your opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with like-minded
individuals, and create a lasting impact.


*Take the First Step*

üîó *Apply Now <https://form.jotform.com/250342766778468>*
üì© *For inquiries:* iiec@iitgn.ac.in | *Visit Us
<https://chat.deepseek.com/a/chat/s/127f9456-4fc6-47ab-bf6e-760519fe586c>*


We can‚Äôt wait to see your groundbreaking ideas at *Hack the Future 2025*!



Warm regards,
*Team IIEC*

--

subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat Hackathon
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 9:44 AM Subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 9:44‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <info@gujgov.edu.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 7:44‚ÄØPM
Subject: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear,

The Education Department, Gujarat has been doing persistent efforts to
institutionalize the Innovation & Startup Ecosystem in the State through
policy, platform, and processes. To augment the support system for
nurturing student Start-ups in the State, second edition of Student
Start-up and Innovation Policy (SSIP 2.0) was launched on 05 January 2022.

Under the Policy, various flagship initiatives have been envisaged through
which youth can get adequate opportunities to harness their creative
potential. We have pioneered various Open Innovation Programmes like
hackathon and executed them at a large-scale.

The 6th Edition of ‚ÄúSmart Gujarat Hackathon‚Äù with special focus on
Artificial Intelligence will be a step forward towards building smart and
sustainable solutions to complex challenges. In this edition of hackathon
around 15,000 students are expected to participate and work on problem
statements. Challenges from various departments of the State Government,
Public Sector Undertakings, Municipal Corporations, District Collectorate,
District Panchayats and industries will be broadcasted to students across
universities, institutes, and schools.

The program will feature problem statements from various sectors providing
students with ample opportunities to engage in Artificial Intelligence and
other emerging technology-based solution- oriented projects. Moreover,
winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable
mentorship support from nodal officers of government departments and
benefits from education department of Government of Gujarat, further
encouraging their pursuit of innovation and excellence.

We request all students from your institute to actively participate in 6th
edition of ‚ÄúSmart Gujarat Hackathon‚Äù. This event presents a fantastic
opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving skills and
innovative thinking. To get more details and further update regarding
registration process and list of sectors students can visit the following
link: https://ssipgujarat.in/hackathon. Teams must select a problem
statement online after registration and login in the portal.

Last date for Team registration is 10th March 2025 and synopsis Submission
is 14th March 2025.

Kindly share this with all your students and faculty members so that they
can participate in this event. For any query, please revert us at
ssipgujarat@gmail.com

Team Hackathon
Student Start-up and Innovation Policy
Education Department, Government of Gujarat
3rd Floor, Block No:2 ,Karmayogi Bhavan
Sector 10-A 382010


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

Dear All,

*The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Department at Charotar
University of Science and Technology is pleased to invite you to
participate in our upcoming Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC) Activity on the
theme "**AI for Social Good ‚Äì Solving Real-World Issues**"*
Date: 7th March 2025
Timing: 12:00 to 2:00 pm
Registration Link: https://forms.gle/4dnzcafVqqNKr8cd9
Rules:

   -

   Students may present AI-based solutions for improving daily life,
   supporting disabled individuals, enhancing healthcare, or addressing social
   causes.
   -

   Students may submit their ideas in a group of up to 3 members.
   -

   Poster Presentation size: A2 *(presentation format is attached
   herewith.)*
   -

   The poster presentation must be in hard copy.

*Exciting Prizes:*

*1st Prize: ‚Çπ1500/-*

*2nd Prize: ‚Çπ1000/-*
*3rd Prize: ‚Çπ500/-*

   - All participants will receive an e-Certificate of Participation.

We request your kind cooperation and adherence to the above rules to ensure
the smooth conduct of the event.



-


*Thanks and Regards,*


*Gaurang A. Patel*

*Assistant Professor*

Department of Mechanical Engineering

Functional Dept: Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

Charotar University of Science & Technology

subject: Arthyantra Recruitment ‚Äì Apply Now for Board Member Positions
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, Arthyantra, the Economics Club of CHARUSAT, is now accepting applications for new team members. This is an opportunity to gain experience in content creation, social media
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

Arthyantra, the Economics Club of CHARUSAT, is now accepting applications
for new team members. This is an opportunity to gain experience in content
creation, social media management, finance, research, and event
coordination while contributing to the club‚Äôs initiatives.

Interested students are required to fill out the Google Form
<https://forms.gle/Aw6fUvSJvebp82tp8> by March 1st. Shortlisted candidates
will be invited for in-person interviews as the next stage of selection.

Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well. I am Dr. Bina Patel, the subject
coordinator for *Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)*. I would like to share with you the
course evaluation structure and important dates.
*Course Evaluation Structure*

The total marks for the course are *100*, divided as follows:

   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì Internal Examination*
   - *20 Marks* for mid-term exams
      - *10 Marks* for two online quizzes (*5 marks each*)
      - *10 Marks* for assignments
      - *10 Marks* for class tests
   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì External Examination *

*Important Dates (Tentative)*

   1. *First Quiz:* 10th March 2025
   2. *Second Quiz:* 1st May 2025
   3. *Class Test:* Last week of April 2025

I am attaching the following materials to help you prepare for the course:

   - Reading materials for *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Assignment examples for  *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Practice examples   *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Complete classwork examples

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact me via email.

Enjoy your mini vacation, and I look forward to seeing you in class!

Best regards,

subject: Don‚Äôt Miss Out: Join Us for the UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University! üåç
snippet: Dear All, We're excited to announce the upcoming UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University on February 28th ‚Äì a must-attend event for students aspiring to study abroad! ‚ú® Here's
content:
Dear All,

We‚Äôre excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* ‚Äì a must-attend event for
students aspiring to study abroad! ‚ú®

*Here‚Äôs what you can look forward to:*

   1.

   *On-the-Spot Counseling*
   Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
   study abroad questions.
   2.

   *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
   Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
   step-by-step.
   3.

   *Exclusive Scholarships*
   Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations like
   the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
   4.

   *One-to-One Profile Evaluation*
   After pre-counseling, meet university reps tailored to your profile for
   more personalized advice.

This event is a your *gateway to transforming their future* and gaining
clarity about your educational journey.

*üìå Don‚Äôt miss out!*
Mark your calendars for *February 28th*, and take your first step toward
international education.

*To register, click the link below*:
*Register Now* <https://arisoverseas.com/uniexplore/>
*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT*
*Time: 10.00 A.M to 03.00 P.M*
*Date: 28 FEB 2025*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you take the next big step
in students academic journey!

*Thanks & Regards,**Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *
AT: Changa, Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat
(T) 02697-265213

subject: Fwd: üåü Women Startup Meet 5.0 ‚Äì Empowering Women Entrepreneurs to Accelerate Action! üåü
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 9:22 AM Subject: Fwd: üåü Women Startup Meet 5.0 ‚Äì Empowering Women
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 9:22‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: üåü Women Startup Meet 5.0 ‚Äì Empowering Women Entrepreneurs to
Accelerate Action! üåü
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Parul Innovation and Entreprenuership Research Centre <
pierc@paruluniversity.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 9:19‚ÄØAM
Subject: üåü Women Startup Meet 5.0 ‚Äì Empowering Women Entrepreneurs to
Accelerate Action! üåü
To:
Cc: CEO PIERC <ceo.pierc@paruluniversity.ac.in>


*Dear Mam/Sir,*

*Greetings from Parul Innovation and Entrepreneurship Research Centre,
Parul University!*

Are you a woman entrepreneur, innovator, or startup enthusiast looking for
the right platform to grow and scale your business?

We are thrilled to invite you to *Women Startup Meet 5.0*, organized by *Parul
Innovation & Entrepreneurship Research Centre (PIERC)*,*Parul
University* happening
from *March 5th to 8th, 2025*.

This premier event is designed to *empower women entrepreneurs*, helping
them *network, innovate, and pitch their startup ideas* to potential
investors, mentors, and industry leaders.

üî• *Why Should You Attend?*
This event offers a *unique opportunity* to connect with like-minded
entrepreneurs, gain valuable insights, and access funding and mentorship to
take your business to the next level.
[image: All Event 01.jpg]

*Event Highlights:*

‚úÖ *Panel Discussions* ‚Äì Engage with top industry experts & thought leaders
‚úÖ *Startup Bootcamp* ‚Äì Hands-on training sessions to refine your business
model
‚úÖ *Women Hackathon* ‚Äì Innovate, collaborate, and create impact-driven
solutions
‚úÖ *Startup Idea Pitching* ‚Äì Present your idea to investors & win grants up
to *‚Çπ2.5L*
‚úÖ *Mentor Garage* ‚Äì Get one-on-one mentoring from experienced entrepreneurs
& investors
‚úÖ *SHE Tales* ‚Äì Hear inspiring stories from successful women entrepreneurs
[image: IDEA PITCHING - 02.jpg]

üí° *Startup Idea Pitching ‚Äì Pitch Your Vision & Get Funded!*

If you have a *brilliant startup idea*, this is your chance to bring it to
life! Our *Startup Idea Pitching* session offers:

‚úÖ *Grant support up to ‚Çπ2.5L for PoC (Proof of Concept) development*
‚úÖ *Mentorship from industry experts & successful entrepreneurs*
‚úÖ *Legal support to help navigate startup regulations*
‚úÖ *Funding assistance of ‚Çπ25,000 for IPR (Intellectual Property Rights)
filing*
‚úÖ *Pre-incubation & Incubation support to help scale your startup*
‚úÖ *Networking with investors, accelerators & industry experts*

üöÄ *Who Should Attend?*

   - Women entrepreneurs and startup founders
   - Early-stage startup teams looking for funding & mentorship
   - Women professionals with innovative business ideas
   - Students & researchers with entrepreneurial aspirations
   - Investors, mentors & industry leaders supporting women-led startups

üìÖ *Event Dates:* *March 5th - 8th, 2025*
üìç *Venue:* *BBA building Ground Floor,PIERC.*

üéüÔ∏è *Limited Spots Available! Register Now to Given QR code Secure Your
Place.*

Join us in this incredible journey to *accelerate innovation, empower women
entrepreneurs, and drive impactful change*! üöÄ

Looking forward to seeing you at *Women Startup Meet 5.0!*
*Thanks & Regards*
*Parul Innovation and Entrepreneurship Research Centre*
*Parul University *
P.O. Limda, Ta. Waghodia,
Dist. Vadodara-391760
Gujarat State, India.
Website: https://www.pierc.org/

--

.

Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)

Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)*. I would like to share with you the
course evaluation structure and important dates.
*Course Evaluation Structure*

The total marks for the course are *100*, divided as follows:

   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì Internal Examination*
   - *20 Marks* for mid-term exams
      - *10 Marks* for two online quizzes (*5 marks each*)
      - *10 Marks* for assignments
      - *10 Marks* for class tests
   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì External Examination *

*Important Dates (Tentative)*

   1. *First Quiz:* 10th March 2025
   2. *Second Quiz:* 1st May 2025
   3. *Class Test:* Last week of April 2025

I am attaching the following materials to help you prepare for the course:

   - Reading materials for *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Assignment examples for  *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Practice examples   *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Complete classwork examples

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact me via email.

Enjoy your mini vacation, and I look forward to seeing you in class!

Best regards,

*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 9:17 AM Subject: Fwd: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 9:17‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at Their Dream
Company!
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Please pass this on to the students.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 20, 2025 at 6:42‚ÄØPM
Subject: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at Their Dream Company!
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/14-Feb/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear [Training and Placement Officer],

With *30,000+ job opportunities* from top companies like *Google, KPMG,
Amazon, EY, and Deloitte,* your students have an incredible chance to
secure an HR interview at their dream company‚Äîand we need your support to
help them seize this opportunity!


*Introducing Dream Job Challenge 2025*
Apna is giving students the platform to showcase their passion and land
interviews at their dream workplaces. They simply need to tell us why they
deserve to work there, and if they stand out, Apna will go the extra mile
to help them succeed.

*How You Can Help:*

   - *Encourage Registration* ‚Äì Ask students to sign up here:
   https://apna-job-web.app.link/e/SqXtrvexVQb
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=be98477a0c746f09e2d6f090de179e2c26939d0d&lat=2025&mid=fce76760055f554abe243f88e21858fff6026a9b>

   - *Ensure Profile Completion* ‚Äì Only completed profiles can access top
   jobs
   - *Promote Dream Job Challenge 2025* ‚Äì Inspire students to take the next
   step

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Jm0pPuX-TxNKy9WdzVYwTqYEcT6BMxe8/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=117518947182740027481&rtpof=true&sd=true

subject: Fwd: üìÖ Don‚Äôt Miss Out: Join Us for the UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University! üåç
snippet: Dear All, We're excited to announce the upcoming UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University on February 28th ‚Äì a must-attend event for students aspiring to study abroad! ‚ú® Here's
content:
Dear All,

We‚Äôre excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* ‚Äì a must-attend event for
students aspiring to study abroad! ‚ú®

*Here‚Äôs what you can look forward to:*

   1.

   *On-the-Spot Counseling*
   Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
   study abroad questions.
   2.

   *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
   Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
   step-by-step.
   3.

   *Exclusive Scholarships*
   Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations like
   the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
   4.

   *One-to-One Profile Evaluation*
   After pre-counseling, meet university reps tailored to your profile for
   more personalized advice.

This event is a your *gateway to transforming their future* and gaining
clarity about your educational journey.

*üìå Don‚Äôt miss out!*
Mark your calendars for *February 28th*, and take your first step toward
international education.

*To register, click the link below*:
*Register Now* <https://arisoverseas.com/uniexplore/>
*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT*
*Time: 10.00 A.M to 03.00 P.M*
*Date: 28 FEB 2025*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you take the next big step
in students academic journey!
regards
Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science And Technology

--

subject: Seating arrangement for Internal Exam Semester-2
snippet: Dear Students, Please find attached herewith seating arrangement for the internal exam. Students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment. Students are
content:
Dear Students,

Please find attached herewith seating arrangement for the internal exam.

Students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
email attachment. Students are required to uphold decorum in
the examination hall. Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic
devices are strictly prohibited within the exam hall. Bags must be left
outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID card. Students have to take
their seat in the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior to the exam time. At
10:15 AM the entry gate will be closed and after 10:20 AM no one will be
allowed to enter the examination hall.

*The exam will take place in Exam Hall 201 (first floor) and 301 (second
floor) of Multi Utility Complex.*
-- 
*With regards,*

*Disha Panchal*
*Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)*- Changa,
Accredited with "*Grade A+*" by NAAC,GOI
Accredited with *Centre of Excellence* by GOG
Email: dishapanchal.dcs@charusat.ac.in <arpitbhatt.dcs@charusat.ac.in>,
Mo. +91 9726219961

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dr Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Feb 18, 2025 at 4:28 PM Subject: Expert Talk on Understanding Quantum Computing: Exploring
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 18, 2025 at 4:28‚ÄØPM
Subject: Expert Talk on Understanding Quantum Computing: Exploring the
Basics, Power, and Future Potential
To: HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute of
Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <
principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FCA CHARUSAT <dean.fca@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal PDPIAS CHARUSAT <principal.pdpias@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar <
depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <hod.itds@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE Depstar <
hod.csds@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), FTE,
CHARUSAT has organized a talk on *Understanding Quantum Computing:
Exploring the Basics, Power, and Future Potential *with an objective to
equip students and staff members with the skills and understanding needed
to navigate this emerging and transformative technology.

The expert of the talk is *Prof. Amlan Chakrabarti [Professor & Director:
A.K Choudhury School of IT, University of Calcutta & Adj. Professor - IIIT
Delhi*.

You may refer to his profile on :
https://www.linkedin.com/in/prof-amlan-chakrabarti-7006323a?utm_source=share&utm_campaign=share_via&utm_content=profile&utm_medium=android_app

The session will be held online, and registered participants will receive a
joining link ahead of the scheduled talk.

*Event Details:*

    Day & Date: Thursday, March 06, 2025
    Time: 12:30 PM - 2:00 PM

To register, please click on the following link:
https://forms.gle/oojcsTfJqxf3KaJ57

We encourage all interested participants (teaching staff and students) to
register and get ready to dive into this rapidly evolving domain.
Registration is open till March 01,2025

For any queries, please feel free to contact:

1. Dr. Dweepna Garg: +919601700945 | dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in
2. Mr. Kashyap Patel: +9199741 96044 | kashyappatel.dce@charusat.ac.in

Thank You

-- 
Regards:
Dr Dweepna Garg
Head Of Department & Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)

snippet: Dear All, Please find attached herewith the final status of approval of the Topics selected by you. Students still pending are hereby informed to complete the selection by today on or before 12:30 PM.
content:
Dear All,

Please find attached herewith the final status of approval of the Topics
selected by you.

Students still pending are hereby informed to complete the selection by
today on or before 12:30 PM.

regards,

On Mon, Feb 10, 2025 at 4:12‚ÄØPM Dr. Kirti Makwana (via Google Forms) <
kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dr. Kirti Makwana shared a form
> [image: Header profile photo]
> Dr. Kirti Makwana (kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in) has invited you to
> *respond* to the following form:
> Dear Students,
>
> Kindly enter the details of Topic of Presentation,
>
> Kindly note, the presentation must be out of scope of syllabus content of
> Digital Electronics (not limited to latest trends/inventions in DEO.
>
> The last day to submit the topic is 13/2/2025 on or before 12:30 PM.
>
> Contact the course coordinator for any query/concerns.
>
> You may access the entered topics using the link:
> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EJPjYhqRPb0nmVcU7RECCkM3l3RSDQQu2_vTq3quzFU/edit?resourcekey=&gid=1640269574#gid=1640269574

subject: Fwd: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:36 PM Subject: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT To: Charusat
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:36‚ÄØPM
Subject: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings!!



To inculcate the culture of scientific research and to motivate students to
explore the opportunities in space science, we are excited to announce a *Space
Talk Series. *This series is customized to offer numerous benefits for
students, including:


¬∑  Awareness of Space Technology

¬∑  Showcasing various ongoing projects related to Space by ISRO

¬∑  Career Opportunities in Space Applications

The first talk in the series is organized by V. T. Patel Department of
Electronics and Communication Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT and it will
focus on the topic titled *"**Indian Planetary Missions: Through the Eyes
of a Scientist"*

We are delighted to have *Dr Arpit Patel, Scientist-E, **Physical Research
Laboratory*, Ahmedabad, as a distinguished speaker. Dr. Arpit has
contributed to numerous payloads in Indian Space Missions such as *Mars
Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan), Chandrayan -3, Aditya L1 *and many more.

Event Details:

¬∑  *Date:* Wednesday, February 19, 2025

¬∑  *Time:* 10:30 am onwards

¬∑  *Location:* Seminar Hall, 2nd floor, A6 Building

We look forward to your active participation in this *Space Talk Series*.
The registration link is as follows:

https://forms.gle/sqitonXPC2Jgxo4YA

For any query, kindly contact *Dr. Killol Pandya, M: 7600004093*,
*killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in
<killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in>*,

Regards,

Trushit Upadhyaya



-- 

Dr. Trushit Upadhyaya

Professor & I/c Principal

Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology

Faculty of Technology & Engineering

Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)

CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, 388421

Petlad, Anand, Gujarat, India.

M: 7874840344

https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Gzsxo-oAAAAJ&hl=en

subject: Fwd: Regarding EOE Lab.
snippet: Dear Students, Civil portion will be completed in lab of MEUD101 EOE Lab by the end of this week so from 24 February 2025 to the end of the semester, Mechanical faculties will conduct 2 hours to
content:
Dear Students,

Civil portion will be completed in lab of MEUD101 EOE Lab by the end of
this week so *from 24 February 2025 to the end of the semester*, Mechanical
faculties will conduct 2 hours to complete EG portion of the EOE laboratory
in EG lab location (323/326/119). So, follow it accordingly.
--

subject: Fwd: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:40 PM Subject: Fwd: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:40‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving
Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIEC IIT Gandhinagar <iiec@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:37‚ÄØPM
Subject: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving
Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To:


Dear Innovator,


Greetings from the IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
(IIEC)!


We are thrilled to invite you to *Hack the Future 2025: Innovating
Intelligent Data Insights*, a national-level hackathon organized by IIEC,
IIT Gandhinagar, in collaboration with the *Ministry of Statistics and
Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India*.


This *36-hour immersive challenge*, scheduled for *March 21‚Äì23, 2025*, at
IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, will bring together developers, designers,
innovators, and students to leverage *AI and data science* in addressing
critical socio-economic and development challenges using publicly available
data.



*Why Participate?*

‚úÖ *Solve Real-World Problems:* Tackle challenges curated by MoSPI,
Government of India, and contribute to meaningful solutions.
üèÜ *Win Exciting Prizes:*

   - *1st Place:* ‚Çπ2,50,000
   - *2nd Place:* ‚Çπ1,50,000
   - *3rd Place:* ‚Çπ1,00,000
   - *2 Special Mentions:* ‚Çπ35,000 each
   üöÄ *Incubation & Piloting Opportunities:* Selected projects may be
   incubated at IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, and piloted in collaboration with MoSPI.
   üöÄ *Network & Learn:* Connect with industry experts, policymakers, and
   fellow innovators to expand your horizons.


*Key Dates*

üìÖ *Application Window:* February 7‚Äì28, 2025
üì¢ *Shortlisted Participants Announced:* March 5, 2025
üí° *Hackathon & Pitching Event:* March 21‚Äì23, 2025


If you are passionate about *AI, data science, and innovation*, this is
your opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with like-minded
individuals, and create a lasting impact.


*Take the First Step*

üîó *Apply Now <https://form.jotform.com/250342766778468>*
üì© *For inquiries:* iiec@iitgn.ac.in | *Visit Us
<https://chat.deepseek.com/a/chat/s/127f9456-4fc6-47ab-bf6e-760519fe586c>*


We can‚Äôt wait to see your groundbreaking ideas at *Hack the Future 2025*!



Warm regards,
*Team IIEC*


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation for participation
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Feb 15, 2025 at 4:50 PM Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation for
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 15, 2025 at 4:50‚ÄØPM
Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation
for participation
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,



"The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things but
their inward significance.‚Äù ‚Äì Aristotle



We are delighted to inform you that the Faculty of Humanities, in
collaboration with Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management, CHARUSAT is
hosting a unique and enriching Pichhwai Art Workshop, scheduled for March
1, 2025. The workshop will be held in the afternoon slot, providing an
excellent opportunity to explore and engage with this traditional form of
Indian art. *Further, this workshop also aims at promoting Indian arts and
culture proliferated under NEP 2020*.



The ancient painting technique known as Pichhwai art, which originated in
Nathdwara, Rajasthan, some 400 years ago, is intricately linked to the
area's religious legacy. The background of Lord Shrinathji, a venerated
embodiment of Lord Shri Krishna, has long been decorated with these
paintings, which originated at the Nathdwara temple. The themes mostly
centre on events from Lord Shri Krishna's early childhood, which depict his
favourite festivals, pastimes, and seasonal festivities.In addition to
their traditional function as sacred temple hangings, Pichhwai paintings
have become more and more popular as home decor, interiors for museums, and
art galleries. Beyond paintings, the motifs and intricate designs are now
replicated on textiles, cushion covers, and carpets, preserving the
artistic legacy in contemporary decor.



We have invited upcoming and enthusiastic artists, Shri Mahesh Rabari and
Ms. Muskan Mehta. The artists conducting the Pichhwai Art Workshop are
highly skilled practitioners dedicated to preserving and promoting this
traditional art form. They have mastered the intricate techniques and
symbolism of Pichhwai Art, bringing its rich heritage to life.



*Workshop details are:*



¬∑  *Date: * March 1, 2025

¬∑  *Day: * Saturday

¬∑  *Time: * 1 pm to 4 pm

¬∑  *Venue:  *Centre Square, IIIM

¬∑  *Registration Link and QR Code: https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7
<https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7>*


[image: adobe-express-qr-code (4).png]



*Last date for the registration: February 21, 2024*


Contact Ms. Jayshree Mehta +91 76001 47568 for details.



Kindly find the event poster and captivating creations by the artists.



Thanks and Regards,





Binit Patel
Bhaskar Pandya


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Bina Patel <binapatel.maths@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Jan 10, 2025 at 1:30‚ÄØPM
Subject: Course Information and Evaluation Details for Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)
To: <24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head Maths <head.maths@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well. I am Dr. Bina Patel, the subject
coordinator for *Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)*. I would like to share with you the
course evaluation structure and important dates.
*Course Evaluation Structure*

The total marks for the course are *100*, divided as follows:

   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì Internal Examination*
   - *20 Marks* for mid-term exams
      - *10 Marks* for two online quizzes (*5 marks each*)
      - *10 Marks* for assignments
      - *10 Marks* for class tests
   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì External Examination *

*Important Dates (Tentative)*

   1. *First Quiz:* 10th March 2025
   2. *Second Quiz:* 1st May 2025
   3. *Class Test:* Last week of April 2025

I am attaching the following materials to help you prepare for the course:

   - Reading materials for *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Assignment examples for  *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Practice examples   *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Complete classwork examples

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact me via email.

Enjoy your mini vacation, and I look forward to seeing you in class!

Best regards,

*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Fwd: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: PRIYA PEDHADIYA <23ce115@charusat.edu.in> Date: Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 11:57 PM Subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: PRIYA PEDHADIYA <23ce115@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 11:57‚ÄØPM
Subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE
LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE.
To: <22depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <23depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>,
<24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: <23ce022@charusat.edu.in>


Dear All,
U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.

Title of the Event:* " CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF
SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "*

*Guidelines:*
1.    Students may submit their creative working project ideas on a drawing
sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.
*Submission Link:* https://forms.gle/GUHRx6sLvhYPatmx7
These can be further modified on the day of presentation [15/02/2025].

2.    Last Extended Date of Entry Submission: 8th February, 2025 [Ideas
through online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate
entry using the shared google form link.

3.    Students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pen or any other tools
[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the day of
presentation [Date: 15/02/2025, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building].
Participants must remain present in MAC LAB (601) [A7 Building] from 09:15
am to 12:00 pm on 15/02/2025, Saturday to present their project ideas.
Students may use presentations and poster to demonstrate their project
ideas.

4.    Students may show Project Implementation

5.    Students may submit their ideas in a group of a maximum 3 students.

6.    You need to submit your poster presentation in hard copy, it's size
should be A3.

7.    Best of the THREE Innovative Ideas will be awarded prize money &
certificate (First prize 1500 Rs/-, Second Prize 1000 Rs/-, Third Prize 500
Rs/-). Others will receive a certificate of participation.

*NOTE : *
Individual entries are also allowed .
For group entries you are free to form a group from any department and any
institute.
Make sure the maximum number of members of the group should not exceed 3 .

For any further query you may please contact student coordinators
( 23CE115 - Priya Pedhadiya (6354914979 and 23CE022 - Devam Ghodasara
(94264 31542) ).






-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Feb 5, 2025 at 9:10 AM Subject: Fwd: MOOC Certification in Entrepreneurship To:
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Feb 5, 2025 at 9:10‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: MOOC Certification in Entrepreneurship
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Yukta Gupta <yukta@turnip.co.in>
Date: Wed, Feb 5, 2025 at 8:08‚ÄØAM
Subject: MOOC Certification in Entrepreneurship
To: Sir/Madam <principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

Recently, Turnip signed an MoU with AICTE regarding our *16-Day
Entrepreneurship Awareness Program*. Turnip was one of the 22 companies
selected as online education partners.
[image: Turnip signs MoU with AICTE]

With this course, scholars can *master fundamental startup concepts in a
simple and practical manner*. It can be conducted as a MOOC certification,
or any value added activity.

* Register via the Official Course Page *
<http://url5505.turnip.co.in/ls/click?upn=u001.3zvY44KeqgXrGb8wCP618VPaUVVizkWV3-2Bae7lmqk2FA1GglId78OJqbJuBqa0KAHJzYcZdZDqqhXtI7y16DxA-3D-3DpJRr_Ga7Lx8pu544RJnPoLnvD8W4pFiMiH0OCAfIBq4xgpeiOyQmkoVWiAR49-2F-2FLVLNcBdm6eC6N62lPSOc3Utx00GUaoIQ77h15zNMA9q-2FiQCraE-2BNKNgL02l0r0gNwj14O5-2Fh-2BBjloEqdIY0ANL4Bey0d7rD4oVGq0BxcBb-2FN4m2XyzapG2KKLkhQye-2FMZFbAezf84S0jtmQNtVAoO0sZ6t0HnkjKoMjPM6mk-2B9TkIAjP9XVIxqrI9lo2tImBu3vAiYvfU9MB31YUKUtGrJvhIbCdhkyq5qGwLPj9Ypd9Ume0ERfwMMv1Z-2F7FvNSN26q0dh7DNaYFzEx37WOUPJgEyR9CxzZ-2FpHXn1GtJsNOwZggW0-3D>

*Course features*

‚úÖ  Duration: 16 days (online, self-paced)
‚úÖ  Reduced fee (28th Feb): *‚Çπ295/-* (incl. quiz and certificate)
‚úÖ  *Upgraded AICTE Evaluated Certificate* with quiz score, institute name
and designation
‚úÖ  Includes course ebook and 100+ startup resources
‚úÖ  Starts immediately after registration and email verification

*Course lessons*

   - Key entrepreneurial traits
   - Why start a startup?
   - How to find startup ideas?
   - Validating startup ideas
   - Total Addressable Market (TAM)
   - Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
   - The Sales Funnel
   - AIDA Model
   - Digital Marketing Funnel
   - Go-to-market (GTM)
   - Product-Market Fit (PMF)
   - Team building
   - Fund raising
   - Forming a company in India
   - Bonus lesson and startup resources

*Course author*

The course is created by *Dr. Rahul Kapoor*, Founder and Director of Turnip
Innovations. He has a successful startup exit within B2B SaaS. He is a
Professor of Entrepreneurship and runs a Section 8 non-profit company as an
incubation center at IMI Kolkata.

*Please share the program details with all students, faculty and innovation
stakeholders*.

Thanks and regards,

Yukta Gupta | Marketing Manager
turnip.co.in
------------------------------

Sent by Turnip Innovations Pvt. Ltd.

subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE.
snippet: Dear All, U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or Physically Challenged. Title of the Event:
content:
Dear All,
U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.

Title of the Event:* " CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF
SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "*

*Guidelines:*
1.    Students may submit their creative working project ideas on a drawing
sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.
*Submission Link:* https://forms.gle/GUHRx6sLvhYPatmx7
These can be further modified on the day of presentation [15/02/2025].

2.    Last Extended Date of Entry Submission: 8th February, 2025 [Ideas
through online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate
entry using the shared google form link.

3.    Students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pen or any other tools
[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the *day of
presentation [Date: 15/02/2025, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building*].
Participants must remain present in *MAC LAB (601) [A7 Building] from 09:15
am to 12:00 pm on 15/02/2025*, Saturday to present their project ideas.
Students may use presentations and poster to demonstrate their project
ideas.

4.    Students may show Project Implementation

5.    Students may submit their ideas in a group of a maximum 3 students.

6.    You need to submit your poster presentation in hard copy, it's size
should be A3.

7.    Best of the THREE Innovative Ideas will be awarded prize money &
certificate (First prize 1500 Rs/-, Second Prize 1000 Rs/-, Third Prize 500
Rs/-). Others will receive a certificate of participation.

*NOTE : *
Individual entries are also allowed .
For group entries you are free to form a group from any department and any
institute.
Make sure the maximum number of members of the group should not exceed 3 .

For any further query you may please contact student coordinators
( *23CE115 - Priya Pedhadiya (63549 14979)*   and   *23CE022 - Devam
Ghodasara (94264 31542)* ).

-- 
Thanks & Regards.
Priya B Pedhadiya.
@23ce115@charusat.edu.in

subject: "Internship_Career -UG Students of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY "
snippet: Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs011 from CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY. Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program! [IMPORTANT] LaunchEd Global in Collaboration IIT KHARAGPUR (
content:
*Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs011** from CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY*.
*Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program!*
*[IMPORTANT]*

*LaunchEd Global* in Collaboration   *IIT KHARAGPUR (Kshitij) is* Organizing
a *2-month training & internship program with certifications from WIPRO
Dice ID, IBM, CISCO, META, and AICTE-approved.  *Gain *industry-leading
skills* and *real-world experience* to advance your career!

*Fill out the Google Form today to reserve your place in the program:*

*https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9 <https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9>*

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information: *
*https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR*
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR>

*Here is an outline of the program's structure.*
*1. Training Outline*

   - *Live Mentoring with Industry Experts:* Evening classes (6:30 PM -
   8:00 PM) are conducted live on the Zoom platform to fit your schedule. Get
   guidance at every step.
- *From Basics to Advanced:* Perfect for beginners and those looking to
   refine advanced skills, starting from scratch.
- *AI-Powered Development Made Easy*: Build applications with minimal
   coding, create innovative solutions using Generative AI, and easily design
   effective AI prompts.
- *LMS Access for Flexibility: *Recorded live sessions will be uploaded to
   the Learning Management System (LMS) and available for 6 months from the
   batch start date. Login credentials will be shared after registration,
   ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace.

*2. Internship Conduct*

   - *10+ Minor Project**: *The minor project is an individual project,
   where students will work on projects related to each topic they are
   learning.
   - *Major Project (CAPSTONE):* The major project is a group project, and
   you will work in a group of 3-4 interns, with specific responsibilities
   assigned to each intern. The company will provide you with all the required
   data and materials for the project.
   - *Resume Building*: Get expert guidance to craft a standout resume that
   gets noticed.
   - *Mock Interviews*: Receive feedback from industry experts to sharpen
   your interview skills.
   - *Masterclasses*: Learn from top leaders in global companies through
   exclusive sessions.

*Certifications Provided*

   - *Course Certificate*: Receive a prestigious certificate from
   IIT-KHARAGPUR (Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate*: Earn a certificate from our partnered MNCs &
   StartUps.
   - *Verified by WIPRO Dice ID*: Both the Certificates will be verified by
   WIPRO Dice ID
   - *100% Placement Assistance: *Join Our Growth Community for Direct
   Placement Support with Top Companies.

Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)
To: <24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head Maths <head.maths@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well. I am Dr. Bina Patel, the subject
coordinator for *Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)*. I would like to share with you the
course evaluation structure and important dates.
*Course Evaluation Structure*

The total marks for the course are *100*, divided as follows:

   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì Internal Examination*
   - *20 Marks* for mid-term exams
      - *10 Marks* for two online quizzes (*5 marks each*)
      - *10 Marks* for assignments
      - *10 Marks* for class tests
   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì External Examination *

*Important Dates (Tentative)*

   1. *First Quiz:* 10th March 2025
   2. *Second Quiz:* 1st May 2025
   3. *Class Test:* Last week of April 2025

I am attaching the following materials to help you prepare for the course:

   - Reading materials for *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Assignment examples for  *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Practice examples   *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Complete classwork examples

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact me via email.

Enjoy your mini vacation, and I look forward to seeing you in class!

Best regards,

*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*

snippet: Dear CSIC Members, kindly inform the students to join on this link by today at 1:50 PM for Sensitization Program. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.) <
content:
*Dear CSIC Members,*
*kindly inform the students to join on this link by today at 1:50 PM for
Sensitization Program.*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.) <ssippmuc@gujarat.gov.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 11:20‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fw: Online SSIP Sensitization Session for Students - Session
Details for Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)
To: Kaminisolanki.mca@Charusat.ac.in <Kaminisolanki.mca@charusat.ac.in>





------------------------------
*From:* Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.)
*Sent:* Tuesday, January 21, 2025 6:12 PM
*To:* pranavdesai.mba@charusat.ac.in; jaiminundavia.mca@charusat.ac.in
*Cc:* ssipgujarat@gmail.com; janaki.joshi@in.gt.com; provost@charusat.ac.in
*Subject:* Online SSIP Sensitization Session for Students - Session Details
for Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)


Dear SSIP Grantee,

Thank you for providing your preferred dates for the online SSIP
Sensitization session. We appreciate your prompt response.

We are pleased to inform you that we have allocated a session based on your
preferences. Here are the session details:

- Session Name: Innovation, Startups & SSIP 2.0 for Students
- Date: 3rd February 2025
- Time: 02: 00 PM Onwards
-  Link to Join the Session:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NDZhZDBkYTctOGI2My00ZjExLTg3NjAtOTA3NjJjNzI1MzZi%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%2205b5fe2e-db2c-48e5-bfd8-778b75cb0f8e%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%225a944030-a39c-4aa6-ba4b-b718834fd228%22%7d


Meeting ID: 439 865 590 833

Passcode: ou9Vn9L5

Important Points to Note:

1. To facilitate a smooth session, students can be assembled in an
auditorium or classroom, and the online session will be projected for their
viewing.
2. Alternatively, links can be provided to students to join the session
directly.
3. Please note that this session is considered an "SSIP Sensitization
Session" event for your institution. Therefore, you are required to upload
event details, including pictures and attendance sheets, on the SSIP MIS
portal.
4. We encourage you to announce an IDEA competition immediately after the
session to encourage students to submit their innovative ideas. This will
enable us to fund a good number of Proof of Concepts (POCs) under this
policy.
5.  All the faculties are requested to join the session for better
understanding about the policy.

If you have any queries or concerns, please feel free to reach out to us.

Thank you again for your cooperation.

Regards,

SSIP -2.0, State PMU

subject: Opportunity to Join Blockchain Discussion on Bharat Blockchain Network
snippet: Dear Students, I hope you are doing well. We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging Blockchain Discussion hosted on the Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community. This is a great
content:
Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well.

We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging *Blockchain
Discussion* hosted on the *Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community*.
This is a great opportunity for blockchain enthusiasts to expand their
knowledge, interact with like-minded individuals, and showcase their
expertise.
*Discussion Details:*

   - *Format:* A structured discussion (not a formal debate) on a relevant
   blockchain topic.
   - *Topic:* Will be shared upon confirmation of participation.
   - *Preparation Time:* 3 days after topic announcement.
   - *Team Requirement:* 2 teams of at least 4 members each.
   - *Prizes:* Exciting rewards for outstanding contributions!

*Why Participate?*

   - Gain insights into the latest blockchain trends.
   - Engage in meaningful discussions with industry professionals.
   - Enhance your knowledge and critical thinking skills in blockchain
   technology.
   - A chance to win prizes for demonstrating exceptional understanding and
   ideas.

*How to Confirm Your Participation?*

To confirm your participation, please *reply to this email* with your team
details, including:

   - *Team Member Names*
   - *ID Numbers*
   - *Contact Numbers*

We look forward to your participation and an insightful discussion!

Best Regards,

*Shrey Lakhtaria**Dhairya Kanabar*
*Campus Ambassador, IDS/BBN*

-- 


Shrey Lakhtaria

Computer Science Engineering, CSPIT.

<https://github.com/shreylakhtaria>
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/shrey-lakhataria/>
<https://www.instagram.com/shrey7120/>

subject: Invitation to Workshop Series: Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications
snippet: Dear Students, We are pleased to invite you to an exciting workshop series on "Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications" organized by the Department of Computer
content:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to invite you to an exciting *workshop series on
"Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications"* organized
by the *Department of Computer Science & Engineering, **Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), Charotar** University
of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT).*
*Workshop Details:*

üìÖ *Date:* 7th February 2025
‚è∞ *Time:* 12:10 PM ‚Äì 02:00 PM
üë®‚Äçüè´ *Speaker:* Dr. Nilesh Dubey, Assistant Professor, Department of
Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR, CHARUSAT
*Objective:*

This workshop aims to provide undergraduate students with a *comprehensive
introduction to quantum computing*, covering its fundamental principles and
real-world applications.

üìå *Register now* and don‚Äôt miss out on this knowledge-packed session!

https://forms.gle/nff8JdvX13CDkpLFA
*Agenda:**Module 1: Introduction to Quantum Computing*

üîπ What is Quantum Computing?
üîπ History and Evolution
üîπ Classical vs. Quantum Computing
üîπ Importance and Impact
*Module 2: Quantum Mechanics Basics*

üîπ Wave-Particle Duality
üîπ Superposition
üîπ Entanglement
üîπ Measurement and Observation
*Module 3: Quantum Computing Concepts*

üîπ Qubits and Quantum Gates
üîπ Quantum Circuits and Algorithms
*Module 4: Quantum Computing Applications*

üîπ Cryptography and Security
üîπ Optimization and Simulation
üîπ Machine Learning and AI

This is a great opportunity to *gain insights into the future of computing
and explore potential research and career opportunities in this field.*

Looking forward to your participation!
[image: Endowment.png]

--
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
Mo. +91 99987 71587


*            Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC, GOI*

--

subject: Fwd: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation | Grant Support By IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 9:17 AM Subject: Fwd: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation |
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 9:17‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation | Grant Support
By IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Jan 31, 2025 at 5:21‚ÄØPM
Subject: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation | Grant Support By
IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore
To: Principal Depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Dr. Amit Nayak

Greetings from IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore !!

We are excited to invite you and your esteemed institution/organization to
participate in the DISHA (Developing Innovations for Successful Harnessing
and Adoption) program, spearheaded by the
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>. This program is an
exceptional opportunity for faculty and student-led startups to bring
groundbreaking innovations to life, transforming ideas into commercially
viable solutions.

About DISHA:
The DISHA program aims to identify, fund, and mentor deep-tech innovations,
facilitating their journey toward commercialization. It focuses on
Cyber-Physical
Systems (CPS) in critical areas such as Digital Healthcare, Intelligent
Manufacturing, and related domains, emphasizing System Modelling,
Simulation, and Visualization.

Who Can Apply:

   -

   Open to faculty, researchers, and students from higher education
   institutes across India who wish to commercialize their technology
by creating
   spinoff startups.
   -

   Faculty, researchers, and students with market-ready products or
   technologies aimed at commercialization.
   -

   Startups already incorporated as Private Limited/LLP by eligible faculty
   and/or researchers and/or students.
   -

   Existing Startups having strong academic link/willing to collaborate
   with academics for technology upgradation/willing to take IP developed
   in academia to the market through their startup.

Program Highlights:

   -

   Financial support of up to INR ‚Çπ50L initially, with additional funding based
   on progress up to INR ‚Çπ50L.
   -

   Comprehensive mentorship in technology and business development.
   -

   Assistance with IP filing, startup registration, and commercialization
   strategies.
   -

   Host institutions will receive grants from the IITI DRISHTI CPS
   Foundation to support startups and research initiatives at their respective
   institutions.
   -

   Access to entrepreneurial resources, including tools and credits for
   early-stage development.

Why Participate?
This initiative provides a unique platform to:

   -

   Bridge the gap between academia and industry.
   -

   Accelerate innovation to market-ready solutions.
   -

   Establish a network with experts, investors, and peers.

We firmly believe your institution‚Äôs or organization‚Äôs expertise and
innovative projects can significantly contribute to and benefit from this
initiative.

For more details on eligibility and application procedures, please refer to
the program guidelines attached here.

The application deadline is 9th February 2025, and we encourage you to
submit your proposals at your earliest convenience.

Link for Application: *Click Here
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/technology-development/disha/>*

We look forward to your participation in shaping the future of innovation
and fostering impactful collaborations.

Note:

   1.

   Guidelines, FAQs and Program Brochure are attached for your reference in
   this email.


*Regards,*

Rekha Ganeshkar

IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation


*E:* *tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>*

*M:*  +919303854671

*W:* drishticps.iiti.ac.in

*A:* IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore

Simrol, Indore, 453552, Madhya Pradesh


<https://www.linkedin.com/company/iiti-drishti-cps-foundation-iit-indore/>
<https://www.facebook.com/DrishtiCPS/>
<https://twitter.com/intent/follow?screen_name=DRISHTICPS&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Eembeddedtimeline%7Ctwterm%5Escreen-name%3ADRISHTICPS%7Ctwcon%5Es2>




-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI
